name: Carin Lake
text:
The room was clean. The doctor was good.
I went in for Anaphylaxis.
I arrived by ambulance and was stopped before exiting said ambulance by a guard wanting to check my temp and covid screen me. He commented my temp was elevated and dis not want to let me in. Medic told him I was in anaphylaxis. He backed up. I received Epi. Enroute to hospital but apparently no one was in much rush to give solu-medrol. Steroids.  Which I really needed.
I obviously didnt die but I definitely wasnt impressed.  The tech was wonderful, the nurse seemed to think very little of me.  Like I was drug seeking. Kinda made me mad when I got well enough to care.
Then we were handed discharge papers and treated like we were dismissed. I had to walk out without assistance or a wheelchair. I was stung on my foot. It was swole up like a Goodyear blimp. I didnt want to walk on my foot. But I wasnt offered a different option. The tech helped me when she realized I was hobbling and had no shoes.
All in all...if this wasnt the closest ER for me..I wouldnt recommend going there. But I didnt die so..yeah.

name: Michael Crowe
text: Once again into the fray. I had a Myelogram done at Image South in Birmingham they did an amazing job with very little discomfort of course they gave the usual possible side effects, one being a headache. I woke up the following day , Saturday, with a mild headache I took a Tylenol and thought nothing else of it. I woke up Sunday morning vomiting very dizzy and the headache was worse. My wife drove me to St. Vincent's St.Clair emergency room and she signed me in and we waited in the waiting room.  We didn't have to wait long until the triage nurse called my name and took me to check my vitals, and the is where competency ended. In all fairness the nurse that came into the room to take care of me was kind and polite. After waiting in the room a PA came in and asked the same questions that had already been asked and decided since I wasn't running a fever I didn't have meningitis and that I needed a CT scan. While waiting for the CT Tech to come the nurse came back in and gave me a shot of phenergan and Imitrex. I have absolutely  no problem at all trying the simplest medications first and I prayed it would work but it didn't. A while later and actual MD came into the room and said, "your CT is clear were going to let you go." I tried to tell him that my head still felt as if it was going to explode and he said call the DR that did your myleogram. I reminded him that it was Sunday and that I wasn't going anywhere until he did something. He left the room and never came back. In just a short while another nurse came in with a paper cup and some ice water. They gave me a norco and a prescription for ibuprofen. I would guess I sae the actual MD for about 15 seconds and the nurse that brought me the medication had a major attitude problem. I told the admitting nurse that I had taken tylenol ibuprofen and asprin already. We left the ER and I went home in exactly the same shape as I went to the hospital.  IF you can at all avoid this ER. I would understand if it were and I went in demanding narcotics.

name: R Butterfly
text: 1 star does not do it justice! My husbands symptoms were misdiagnosed and dismissed on 2 separate occasions from Crestwood ER which delayed treatment significantly. On the second trip the doctor insisted he didn’t have anything serious like Guillain -Barre despite his legs, hands, and face going numb and he had lost the ability to walk over the previous week, in an otherwise healthy adult man. He was confirmed to have Guillain-Barré syndrome by Huntsville Hospital. We are now being sued by Crestwood for $8k in medical bills which were improperly filed BY THEM despite multiple requests from myself to file them properly. My husband has health insurance and should have only paid a co pay! We owe extensive real medical bills to HH where he had 2 extended stays and 3 weeks in rehab recovering. The lawyer has been relentless and could care less about any of the documents we have provided! Stay far far away! I have never encountered any care or lack there of so bad overall in my life. Not only did they not properly treat or care for my husband who had a very emergent condition that needed treatment but then they are suing us for nearly $10k we don’t actually owe them. Go anywhere but Crestwood if you have a choice.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Crestwood Medical Center - Emergency Room. We love hearing about these experiences! If there's anything we can do for you in the future, we are happy to help!

name: Lana Dergunov
text: 72 year old and 80 year old COVID positive patients waited 11 hours (7 hours in the waiting room with other patients) to be seen by Nurse Practitioner at the ER.  Sent home with the suggestion to contact Medical records in 2 days for the results of blood test and X-Ray.

resp.text: We're disappointed to hear of these experiences. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at (256) 429-4079 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Taylor ben
text: Unbelievable slow. I been here 6 hours in ER. Some ppl have been get 7-8 hours. If u have an emergency you might wait on your doctor, go to outpatient center, or go to another hospital.

resp.text: It is disappointing to learn when experiences are not positive. We take such feedback as an opportunity to improve. Thank you for letting us know.

name: Kendal Zabel
text: The ER staff on 11/4 (PM) was outstanding. Even the gal who did the admission paperwork was funny and kind. Kaitlyn, our nurse was patient with us and all of our questions, everyone that we met was great. Ended up in the endoscopy procedure room and they were absolutely wonderful, too. Carol and the our nurses was outstanding!

resp.text: Kendal Zabel, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team. Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. Thank you again for letting our team know how we did! We look forward to helping again if you need us in the future. Take care!

name: dietitian4u
text: Slow and slow 11 hours in waiting room after a car accident!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving us feedback. It is disappointing to learn when experiences are not positive. We appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve.

name: Ty LaStrapes
text: I had severe cramping....I thought it food poising.  I was seen within 10 mins of arriving.  CAT Scan, urine, & blood all taken within 90 mins.  Super nice staff too.

resp.text: Hi Ty Lastrapes, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Crestwood Medical Center. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We hope you have a great day.

name: Dan Carbone
text:
Second visit in two days for the same thing. 6 hours and no end in sight. No doctor, no pain meds. Severely understaffed for a town this size. There are other options and they will be used from now on.

And I received a response to my issue ..... a month later.

resp.text: Hi, Mr. Carbone. Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience. Here at Crestwood Medical Center, we strive for excellence, and are disappointed to hear that you did not have a positive experience. When you have an opportunity, please reach out to us at (256) 429-4074 so we can discuss your concerns further. Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: L T
text: Went to the ER because it was a weekend and I had been vomiting for days and could not even keep small sips of water down. I was so dehydrated and my kidney's were starting to hurt. I was put in a room fairly quickly but after that it all went down hill. It was an hour before a nurse came in and another 2 before the doctor appeared for a whole 60 seconds. It was another hour before the nurse returned with IV fluid so I had dehydrated even more. They took x-rays and did blood work and the Dr. said everything looked "fine." But according to the labs my kidney numbers were very off. After more hours alone in the room eventually I had to call for a nurse and she said the Dr. had ordered some medicine to be put in my IV that would help stop the vomiting but she was busy and couldn't bring it earlier when it was ordered. The vomiting never stopped and when I was released 8 hours later I was given a RX which could not get filled until the pharmacy opened in the morning only to discover it was an ORAL RX to help me stop vomiting. How did they expect for the RX to stay down if nothing else was? Worse $240 co-pay ever. They did absolutely nothing for me.

name: Roxie
text: Been in the er for 9+ hours seen the doctor twice. And was told she "dropped the ball " on me because I wasn't critical enough

resp.text: Hi, Roxanne. Thank you for taking the time to leave us this feedback. Here at Crestwood Medical Center, we strive for excellence, and are disappointed to hear about your experience. Please reach out to us at 256-429-4074 when you can so we can address this situation directly. Thank you and have a great day.

name: Keey Keey
text: CRESTWOOD on Airport Rd is so trifling. I’m 19 in pain & haven’t been seen or given a update on anything .. I’ve been sitting here for 4 hours  .They never give good service ... All I see is a bunch of white folks acting like they know what they doin

name: Jess Hess
text:
Absolutely horrible visit will NEVER go again. Labs/exam/
Treatment never done for multiple black widow bites and a brown recluse. Rude staff refused to help always excuses for all issues ...fyi lawsuit is coming!
disgusting room filled with bio hazard waste all over the room dirty bloody pillow bed cover was worst never changed in between myself and however many days and/or patients covered in filth with pubic hair and left over lededs stuck to it....not to mention never knowing my name or minimum problems!

name: Joann Rutherford
text: Couldn't have been treated better. Great staff. Very caring.

name: Carrie Shelley
text: Been there twice in one week once with chest pains and anxiety, the next I had a dizzy spell and fell and hurt hip leg and back, and they gave me Aleve for pain, those two bills will go againsty credit credit cause they did absolutely nothing for me I agree I would not take my dog there, I'll go to Huntsville or out of town hospital sucky sucky Drs and hospital

name: Janene Shallenberger
text:
Started using after getting fed up with HH .
3 e room visits and several tests ordered by my doctor and never a bad experience!
Generally a high level of care with great staff

name: Jonathan pike
text: Got me in and out really fast!

name: Janice Hunter
text: i would not even take my dog here I love my animals too much

name: Tam Tam
text: Worse ER ever ! Went in at 5pm and received blood work. Its 11:30 and I was never seen . I do not recommend. I was told I had 1 person ahead of me and all of sudden 15+ names are called except mine . I had to get my records emailed to me . If you’re in a real emergency do not come here . Also they don’t clean anything down after covid patients , disgusting.

resp.text: We're always disappointed to hear about a negative experience in our Emergency Department and use your feedback to improve. We are experiencing higher than normal volume in our ER right now which has created longer wait times for some patients.  If you are willing to share more about your experience, we hope you will call (256) 429-4079. Thank you.

name: Mega Boombox
text: UAB finest Care facility. Parking lot was well lighted and plenty of parking. Security at the front door was very nice and helpful. Triage nurse was very nice and thorough. The doctor came in and explained treatment plan and had a pleasant bedside manner. All employees in the E.R. was very helpful.

name: Abby Binion
text: Our experience was incredible. We had no wait, my husband was examined and treated promptly. All of the staff we encountered were experienced, kind, thorough, and worked well together as a team. We particularly loved his nurse, Julie. We were extremely glad we chose a little bit of a drive, in order to be seen quickly at a facility with such high quality.

name: Raven Isom
text:
Worse service ever
I arrived at 11:30am due to having numbing, tingling and no feeling in my right side.. I was in the waiting room to 4:00pm not being seen by anyone.. I asked the nurse in the front. She stated that there weren’t any rooms available… people came after me were seen and left… I was literally put last on the list…

name: Heather Hosmer
text: I have been here 3 times, twice for my toddler and once for myself and I’ve had nothing but good experiences. Everyone has been so kind and thorough. I’m thankful to have an ER so close by.

name: latonya megginson
text: If it wasn’t for the staff and the inability to give zero stars that’s what they would have!!! The triage nurse and the nurse when I went to my room were AWESOME!! However, I feel like the doctor completely disregarded me. The primary reason I was there was ignored. Even after being discharged the literature he gave was on something other the my primary symptom. I was pretty much given a shot of pain meds and immediately sent home. If it wasn’t for my nurse waiting to make sure the pain meds I was given wore off some and I wasn’t “loopy”. I would’ve been on the road under the influence of opioids that he literally just gave me… smh… THE DOCTOR JUST DIDN’T SEEM TO CARE AT ALL!!!!

name: Hang Nguyen
text: I came here Saturday afternoon due to extreme difficulty with breathing caused by COVID. There was no wait time and plenty of open beds. Everyone I interacted with from security, nurses, techs, and Dr. Wallace were some of the absolute sweetest people I’ve ever encountered within the healthcare environment. This was my first time ever going into an ER and I was extremely anxious already. They listened to everything that I had to say, answered all of my questions, and explained everything to me thoroughly. To say that they went above and beyond to take care of me would be an understatement. Terrific bedside manner and everyone was so down to Earth. I was recommended to go here by several friends and coworkers and I’m so glad that I did. I feel like these people saved my life and I can’t thank them enough.

name: Chris Alessi
text:
Avoid this place.
Do your self a favor and go to a real hospital.
I went here for severe pain.
I was given a test unrelated to my condition.
And then told that they could not administer pain medication.
I was told to take a over the counter anti inflammatory .
So I went to a real emergency room and was treated for my condition,  appropriately.
This visit cost me over $2000.00 and for nothing.

name: lacey H
text:
This hospital has missed bone breaks two different times.
Please avoid if you suspect you have broken a bone.

name: Wyatt Pugh
text: Everyone from the security guard to the nurses to the doctor was very professional and thorough. I would even say they went above and beyond what I expected. The nurses and doctor listened to my explanation very carefully, asked thoughtful question, performed reasonable tests and gave me a diagnosis I have total confidence in. This is a real, professional emergency room, not a fly-by-night doc-in-a-box. I do not WANT to go back, mind you, but it is good to know they are there.

name: josh thomas
text: The best medical staff I have ever had to deal with

name: greg carroll
text: Horrible security guard, rude nurses, incompetent staff. When I was finally allowed to talk to a doctor I felt better. Im still requesting to speam to the office manager for the poor handling of my mothers visit.

name: Bri Wolford
text: They only got one star because I can’t put zero. I went in there for a spider bite on my face close to my lip that’s possibly a brown recluse bite. They gave me no antibiotics because they said it would have to be infected before giving any medicine. No preventative or nothing. So basically when your face is rotting off come back and will give you antibiotics.. And there was no patient care I felt like they treated me like I’m crazy. 0/10 Would not recommend.

name: John Katalik
text: Awesome from the time I entered the emergency room. Foot fracture. Checked my vitals and got to my room. Nurse was prompt, X-rays within minutes, Doctor in 15 minutes with diagnoses. Both nurses great. WTG UAB Gardendale!

name: Meagan Hacker
text: Clean with a nice staff!

name: Ashley Dominguez
text:
This is the ONLY ER I will come to. I have come here several times; so have several family members and friends and none of us have had a bad experience yet.

The doctors, nurses and support staff are all amazing. The are professional, caring and quick with a smile, helping hand a d even fast wit.

name: John Cruse
text: Worst experience EVER! My Sister went in with her ear hurting so bad she was in tears! They took 4 hours to see her and when they finally did they said "Yep its an ear infection". They provided her prescription ear drops (nothing for pain), not even ibuprofen or Tylenol then sent her on her way. Today its hurting worse and she is completely in tears (not an easy feat for her). Go to a different Dr and she has a 102 degree fever, an ear infection, plus! This time, by a competent Dr she was prescribed an antibiotic shot, Steroid Shot, oral antibiotics, pain medication (due to the severity), and the PROPER EAR DROPS! You are better off going to a veterinarian than come here, at least there,  you have a reason to be treated like an animal.

name: C. Allen
text: If you are seeking care, this is not the place to go. I recommend that you do everything within your power to not come to this facility. If you are presented with Nurse Practitioner Jonathon Borella, for your own well being, leave immediately. Borella is extremely unprofessional, condescending, and frankly should have his license revoked. I can not express in words how unfit for employment Borella is. If you value your health, do not seek care from Johnathon Borella and avoid this facility.

name: swole white
text: I had to go at 11 at night I was in and out in under than an 2 hours had everything explained to me and was very well taken care of

name: Allison Brackett
text: We were advised by a doctor that symptoms daughter had were worse than a concussion and she needed to be seen. Went to the ER and they literally only looked in her ears. No scans, no tests, didn't even touch the area of head that was injured and said it was just bruised and sent her home with 4 pain pills. St. Vincent's ER did a CT Scan and diagnosed  a concussion with 4 days of bedrest needed. Absolute worst experience! We will never be back. Getting in and out quick doesn't mean the service will be good.

name: Phylli Celeste
text: Very fast and friendly. They don't just  leave you in a room to wait. They're constantly checking on you and updating. Wonderful facility!!

name: Kayla Phillips
text: The worst. You maybe get to see the doctor a total of 5 mins and your reason for being there is non important.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: The entire staff was caring and compassionate. They showed more concern about my family members heath than simply collecting the co pay. They got us in quickly and eased our minds during our stay.

name: Lisa Gay
text: If I could give 0 stars, I most defiantly would. Gave me a muscle relaxer and sent me on my way. Did a urinalysis and no other test. No CT, blood work...etc. I ended up having to go to another ER and found out that I have a kidney stone. I would recommend going to another ER.

name: Keely Hawkins
text: We had a very great experience here. No wait, all the doctors/nurses were very kind. We went in for our baby and they took great care of us

name: Alecia Stephens
text: I would have liked to give them 5 stars because of hearing such great things about them. Some of the nurses were RUDE! My mom was in so much pain, crying and upset and they were just making comments/looks that were uncalled for. I had to really bite my tongue to not say anything- it hurt to see how they were doing her. Oh and the lady at the counter RUDE- Making it known my mom had a copay and how much it was and she needed to pay before “running out the door” (my mom was in a wheelchair) -she didn’t even have a chance to get her wallet from me yet- overall not the best experience.

name: adam aya
text: My son just fell at daycare and have and front door didn’t let go to see my son

name: Katie Toro
text:
I give 2 stars because 2 who have seen me in the past treat me with respect.

Dr. Willie Gilford and his staff wanted me just out. They kept telling me things straight to my face that I knew were false, because of past treatments. Like I told my primary the time before this time I saw Dr. Gilford, it is set in stone this time. I won't be going to the ER unless I am half dead. He acts like his time is being wasted with you from the moment he walks in. Then they wonder why patients get so upset. Also, he told me and wrote on discharge papers one thing, and I spoke to my specialists on call the next day to find out he falsified documents. So, if I had found a ride to Birmingham AGAIN the next morning it would have been another waste of a trip over an hour drive. I suggest if he says his name is Dr. Gilford just get out of there and go somewhere else. The charge nurse said "You are not bleeding out or have COVID, so it isn't an emergency". I questioned him on this statement and he accused me of putting words in his mouth. At this point I was already beyond mad, because nobody could be truthful. So, if it is Dr. Gilford leave. Unless he sees you half dead then he may help you, but even then I don't know if I would trust.

Looks like Dr. Gilford can't take truthful reviews of him and has to go about destroying patients lives with other providers. He doesn't need to be in any leadership position of his kind if he can't take reviews from patient experience with him. He is teaching employees to falsify documents on patients. I have visual proof of it all.

name: Zach Clayton
text: I came in throwing up nothing but blood. They gave me zofran and protonic and sent me on my way an hour later. I didn't make it out of the parking lot without throwing up more blood. Now I'm at St. Vincent's East for the third night in a row, getting a blood transfusion because they were only worried about getting me in and out. If you're REALLY sick, go elsewhere.

name: Blake Storey
text: Joke of a hospital

name: Tammy Spencer
text: Fiance went in last night with chest pains and high BP 177/114 They didnt do a thing he was back out in 30 minutes no tests nothing!!! Was told if it got to 200 come back!! I wouldn't take my dog to see them!!! If something happens we will seek out an attorney!!

name: john1233217
text:
If you have an absolute TRUE medical emergency that needs direct immediate attention in a professional manner, with timely variables that are put into consideration from the staff, regarding patients...
I HOPE YOU HAVE TIME TO GET HERE, before you get worse.

name: Justin Erwin
text: Very clean,professional,very thorough with everything and fast to be seen  never tried to talk above our head and treats you very well  would recommend  to everyone

name: Cynthia Holder
text: Such a clean and modern facility. Everyone there was so helpful and friendly. Great first visit .😁

name: Rachel Sanders
text: Fast and efficient, wonderful care that's close to home.

name: Kim carreker
text: I can’t even express, in words,  the level of professional and experienced, beyond excellent care I have received here TWICE! This place is awesome, and so is the staff!!!!!!!!!!

name: Almost Registered
text: Great service, friendly people & may I add that it’s SUPER CLEAN!

name: David Vaught Jr.
text: I go there 2 times they do the same  C T scan w/contrast  both times I have a rare syndrome and that contrast is not good for my kidneys .They should know this because I've told them twice And my head was hurting when I was there last and it is still hurting.And by me having insurance they do expensive tests that are not necessary .I wish I could give zero stars.As of today I have the same issue as what I went to them with and get a very very high bill .That they want me to pay.And after a hour waiting after the not necessary test I had to ask the cleaning lady to get a doctor to let me go .Because they forgot I was there .Incompetent Staff

name: S. Davis
text: Amazing place & people very clean and very friendly staff and well organized, i trust them 100% for my care and my other half, and my family's care.

name: Toni Ashcraft
text: This place was so clean and efficient the staff was friendly helpful and made me feel at ease

name: Phil Pearson
text: Great Care, Very Professional

name: Whitney Chambless
text: Awful! Will never go again!

name: Jamie Poland
text: The wait time to see a doctor is not good at all, although I know that they see many patients through the E.R.  People are in pain, sick, and hurting and I have to realize that it takes time to see each patient. After we finally got in after 10 hours, we saw a nurse for evaluation of symptoms, vitals were taken, and blood work was done. The nurse we saw was very nice, as was the doctor. More tests were done and I was diagnosed and sent home with prescriptions. Overall experience out of 5 was a three.

resp.text: Feedback is important to help us improve. Please contact us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) at your convenience so we may discuss your review. We appreciate your time and hope to hear from you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: lashaun d sanders
text: My nurse Ran i think that was his name. He is a traveling nurse from Tennessee. Very respectful attentive and just overall a nice person to be your caregiver when in need. All staff was very polite on the evening that I attended. Couldn't ask for a better crew of what you had that night August 2nd 2021

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: TeLisa Webb
text: I'm not from this area and gotten in an accident on expressway on my way home. The ambulance brought my mom and I to this hospital. This is by far the most friendliest hospital I've ever been to. They got me stitched up and my mom checked out within the hour and a half that it took for my sister to make it to us and EVERYONE WAS SO FRIENDLY. It was a very comforting experience

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: David Holmes
text: This was a first time ER experience for me.From entering the building and registering everyone was helpful and welcoming. Everything was handled in a timely manner. The nurses were very nice and made me feel at ease. Catlin was very proficient. Dr Humphries was the ER doctor and he rates a 10. He listened and sought to find the answer to my problem. He made me feel at ease. As I said this was my first ER experience and when and if I need the ER again I will go to St Vincent's East and will recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! We work hard to provide high quality care. And we are committed to delivering compassionate care to the community. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Harold Waldrop
text: Upbeat and humourous spirit  by all  employees kind and friendly,  very professional and informative with condition and a timely matter. Very impressive 👍. The term Emergency Room is fitting for the services

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Sabrina Ross
text: My daughter went in for back, neck and head pain from a car accident.  We waited in the waiting room for 4 hours. When she finally was sent to get an xray where after she waited in a room for 1.5 hours. No doctor ever came to see her, ever asked questions or looked at her. Im almost certain they forgot she was even there. We finally left the room to find somebody and ask them what was going on to let them know we were still here and sure enough 10 minutes later someone came back with papers saying she was done. Had we not walked out the room to find somebody to let them know we were waiting I'm sure we still would've been there a few more hours.  I know the ER has longer wait times than a doctors office but 5.5 hours just to get an xray without actually being looked at. Wow. The staff at check in were nice and helpful but that was the only positive of the experience. This was our first time at St Vincent's ER.

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Misty Harrison
text: IT WAS FAST PEOPLE WAS NICE. GOT ME N AND OUT. WISH THEY WOULD HAVE ADMIT ME BECAUSE STILL HIGH FEVER HAVEN'T ATE N 4 DAYS. THREW UP ALL NIGHT LAST NIGHT. DOCTOR AND EVERYONE WAS GREAT

name: Dugan Nash
text:
The emergency was real, the pain excruciating, the staff jaded and skeptical. No one wants to go to the hospital. When the staff doesn’t get your name right, tells you they would rather do anything but the profession they are in. Once they did the bare minimum to make sure death wasn’t imminent, they said adíos.

Not only did they half way bandaid the issue, but they left me in my room to find my own way out. Still in pain, still sick, just not completely dying. Even their diagnosis was a joke.

name: Jonathan T
text: I had been experiencing abdominal pain for a couple of weeks and was concerned it was serious once the pain got more severe so I went to around midnight worried I had appendicitis. I was in an exam room in less than 20 minutes. I had a CT scan and lab work and was still out of there in less than 3 hours. The staff was friendly and helpful and the doctor was nice. They set my mind at ease.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! We work hard to provide high quality care. And we are committed to delivering compassionate care to the community. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Jessica Burkett
text: Waited a little over an hour, wasn’t too bad because the doctor I saw was wonderful, treated me & got me out quickly & was thorough. He told me to come back if I was in anymore pain that’s what he’s here for. I’ve never been told that! Thank you Doctor Humphreys! Your Exceptional!

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. We will pass it along to our leadership team. Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Wendell Harvey
text: Upon entering there was no one to take my temperature due to this Covid thing. Once that was done it was some of the best medical care I had received moving forward. Autumn my ER nurse was outstanding along with the girls in the CAT scan department and the doctor all performed outstanding service. I am a 43 year veteran in the plumbing service business and know what good service is and I received it here thanks again

name: Jada Lewis
text: The atmosphere of this hospital has changed completely with the name. The location in Trussville has always been my family’s go to hospital. This past Sunday I had to go due abdominal pains and chest pains. Let’s just say they sent me home drugged up but still in pain. My nurse got an attitude with me because I told them that they didn’t help me out at all. Sitting in a room in  excruciating pain almost screaming out for help and nurses would just look in my room and keep waking. I was treated for period cramps and sent home. Again I came in with abdominal pains and chest pains. They honestly need to re-evaluate the nurses and doctors that they have working for them.

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Terri ME Hood Noojin
text: The kind, professional staff was amazing from the moment we entered the building! Going to the ER is a scary experience but made so much more comforting by the staff in every department and through every step! I would rate it more than 5 stars if that were an option!

resp.text: Hi, thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Madison Lynn
text: Will never go back...if I'm dying keep driving that's how awful it was

name: Dreka Fine
text: I had a pleasant experience at St. Vincent's East. The staff was great & accommodating, the doctor was very engaging & nice & my wait time from arrival to departing was under 2 hours!

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. We will pass it along to our leadership team. Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Mamie Rhetta
text: Other than the wait time everyone was wonderful and friendly and very helpful they apologize constantly for the long wait time and I really appreciate that I haven't been to the  ER for myself in all my life with my children many times but I know that every single one of the people who worked there does everything that they can to help everyone and  for that I truly appreciate that it was a first time for me to come to the ER but I will truly say that I was helped for coming very nice doctor and nurses outstanding 😊❤

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. We will pass it along to our leadership team. Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

text: It was hard for them to stick me, because I was dehydrated,  and they wanted to draw blood in the front and then to stick me again when I hot in the back. Anybody would know it would be hard to stick so why would you stick me more than once. Then the nurse did not understand I would have to use the restroom when I was hydrated.  The head air transport nurse was the best. Kayle tried to stick me where I told her she wasn't going to find anything, so I kept getting stick with no blood being drawn.

name: Jodi George
text: From start to finish was an amazing experience. The staff was extremely friendly and professional. Dr. Turnley is wonderful.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Kayla Mcmillian
text: The staff was wonderful, my little one had something lodged up his nostril and they were so sweet to him and made it such an easy trip to the doctor.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. We will pass it along to our leadership team. Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Catherine Clark
text: The staff let my 2 year old sit in the waiting room for more than 2 hours with a fever of 106. I asked multiple times for some tylenol or ibuprofen to bring her temp down as it was at a very dangerous level. Didn't even get to see a dr. Only a nurse practitioner. Wasn't ever put into a room. Went to triage and then waited in a blood draw room for 30 mins then back to the waiting room. Very poor experience.

name: Sheila Oswalt
text: They were all helpful and friendly from the registration to discharge. The dr was very caring and thorough. Very pleased with the services there.

The second radiologist confirmed they couldn't even review for the part of my hand that was in the most pain because the X-ray cut that part of my hand out of the frame. Now I have to file a quality of service complaint and go have a second X-ray completed despite the fact that I clearly pointed out where my pain was and where the injury was on my hand yet they failed to properly X-ray that area during my E.R. visit.

Maybe focus on the quality of care instead of focusing on how fast you can get patients out the door.

name: April W
text:
My family is from Georgia and we were visiting Barber for the weekend when my husband started experiencing severe stomach pains.  The local urgent care suggested we visit the St. Vincent East ER for a CT scan/ultrasound to check his appendix.  As we were being discharged from urgent care, I looked up the reviews for St. Vincent and became nervous about visiting a hospital with such low ratings.

Once we arrived (on a Saturday evening), we were greeted by a friendly Registrar who checked him in and within 10 minutes we were called back to a room.  Within 2.5 hours, they had drawn blood, received the results, ordered a CT scan with contrast, diagnosed my husband with appendicitis, started him on antibiotics and began the process for him to be admitted with an appendectomy scheduled for first thing Sunday morning.

The nurses in the ER were very kind and attentive!  Always asking if we needed anything and checking in frequently with updates.

Once my husband was admitted to the 6th floor, we met Kim who assisted the nurse.  I cannot praise her enough for the wonderful care my husband (and myself) received from her!!  You can tell immediately that she has a pure passion for what she does, and the people put under her care!!  She knew I was going to stay the night and without asking, she requested a cot and provided us with extra pillows and even brought me a gown and comfy socks so that I didn’t have to sleep in my day clothes.  She was so courteous during vital checks by keeping the lights off and working quickly to try not to disturb my husband while he was sleeping.

Dr. Nguyen was the surgeon who came and spoke with me before the surgery. preparing me for what to expect post-surgery.  They kept him for several hours after the surgery to ensure everything was working properly as the anesthesia wore off.

When it was time to be discharged, my husband’s pain levels were creeping up and he asked for some pain medication before driving 3 hours back home.  He was told that he would have to stay another hour for observation if he took the pain meds.  At that point, he just wanted to get home and in his own bed, so he declined the meds.  The nurse was kind enough to call the doctor to get approval for one of the pain pills he was prescribed to help him get home in the most comfort possible.

Overall, I could not have asked for better care for my husband and would have no hesitations recommending this hospital.

text: If I could give a 0 I would they're awful I sat in the waiting room from 5 to 2 in the morning, wasn't given any pain medicine didn't get my results for my urine, blood work or cat scan. They told me the doctor has left for, the night I wouldn't recommend this hospital to anyone.

name: Mark Calvert
text:
On Saturday, 9 September, 2017, I fell on a sidewalk and badly bruised my ribs.  I had this same injury almost 20 years ago and was fairly confident that this was the same injury.  When I had this injury previously, I went to St. Vincent's Occupational Health Clinic which was on U.S. 280 at that time and the physician told me that it was CRITICAL that I breathe fully with sufficient expansion of my lungs (which would cause some expansion of my rib cage and the accompanying pain) to prevent the risk of developing pneumonia.  At that time, I was about 30 and in good health and I was prescribed Hydrocodone APAP 10 (mg?) and that worked well.  I had very little pain when breathing or sleeping and recovered within a couple of weeks.

I'm now about 50, about 60 lbs heavier than I was then, and have been unemployed for a while but I'm attending graduate school to attain a Masters degree to teach science at the high school level.  When I visited the ER on the 9th not long after the fall, I received the same diagnosis of bruised ribs, the same warning that I must breathe fully to prevent pneumonia, but then was prescribed 500 mg Naproxen (same thing as Aleve) and a muscle relaxer.  The medicine was almost useless as it was only moderately effective for only about half the period that it was indicated.  I was still not breathing properly and had intense pain for more than 50% of the time.  The pain affected my breathing, my sleep, and my ability to concentrate on my studies.

I called my primary physician (as ER instructions indicated), Dr. Jack Zaremba, after a couple of days and told his nurse that the medication wasn't effective.  They stated that I would have to come in for a visit before they could DECIDE if I needed something stronger.  I had just paid probably $100 on a copay for the ER along with the cost of the useless medication and now they wanted to suck some more money out of me before they could DECIDE if I my excruciating pain was worthy of some effective medication.  I refused.  The ER had already diagnosed me and erred in prescribing medication, so why should I have to pay more money to get an effective prescription?

I'm sure that the opioid "epidemic" is affecting the judgement of physicians so that they are hesitant to prescribe certain pain medication, but due to their monopoly on prescribing certain types of medication, they have a duty to make sure that they prescribe sufficient medication to their patients.  The only reason I went to the ER is because I remembered that stern warning by that physician years ago about the risk of pneumonia and I expected that they would prescribe something that would actually help suppress the pain so that I could comply with their instructions about breathing.  By merely calling my physician and requesting more effective medication, they've probably added me to some DEA list of pill poppers.

After three weeks, I'm noticing just a slight change in the level of pain which I experience.  I don't think that I'm breathing fully yet, but I don't seem to have contracted pneumonia yet.  I'm just using over the counter pain meds which are just as useless as the prescription meds were, but I see no reason to return to a physician and help them with their country club dues if they aren't going to do their job to relieve my suffering.  The next time I go to the ER at St. Vincent's East will be involuntary and via an ambulance.

Every nurse & hospital personal I came in contact with during my procedure was the most professional, caring , patience, nice & understanding group.  A special shout out to my nurse, I am sorry to say I do not remember her name because I got side tracked after she told me she was originally from Prichard, Al.  I have relatives from Mobile .  So I started calling her Ms.  Prichard.  She was absolutely
Amazing!   She took her time. She did not treat me or my wife like she was on a time schedule & had to get us out of there!  Wonderful experience when you are stressed & concerned.  The only average to low side was the front of the hospital morning receptionist, she was just a little grumpy!

name: Kristie Lagarde
text:
I really wish that you were able to give zero stars. This place doesn’t come close to deserving a half of star.
Yesterday while visiting our camp in Alabama I became very ill all of a sudden. Started passing out, loss of strength, shortness of breath, and severe vomiting. My husband rushed me to the nearest hospital which sadly was this one.
Never have I seen a hospital that instead of being manned by a human being you had to press a doorbell for assistance. With so many people in the waiting area no one could remember who pressed the button first and we were told it was a first come first serve basis. This is ludicrous. It should be based by emergency circumstances. After sitting down for a few minutes and no one coming to check on us another patient said he had been there for over 2 hours and hadn’t spoken to the first person yet. I asked my husband to drive to the nearest fire station so that someone on call could check my pulse, blood pressure something to ease my mind that I was not having a heart attack. Needless to say no one was at the fire station and thankfully we found The Main Street clinic that was able to see me. If you feel like you are dying you are better off driving to another hospital you may have better chances on surviving.

text: Really should be a zero!! I gave birth to my 3rd son at this hospital. Very very very unprofessional. This place is not equipped to care for newborns. My week old son still has 8 different little cuts in his heels from being poked for labs. Another spot in his hand from an iv. He was noted by a nurse to have rapid breathing a few hours after being born. And because the nurse felt my mixed babies complexion was not normal. Hint MIXED they started blood work. After keeping his under lights even when his levels were not high and poking and running labs when they all kept coming back normal. They continued to give him antibiotics and iv fluids against me. I am a lab technician myself. I knew his labs and his levels were fine. The Dr ignored my request all day. Even advised he was keeping him for jaundice for 5 days even though his levels were so low that he wasn't even a low risk. His breathing was rapid but his vitals were noted and taken when his temp was 99 degrees from the incubator or at the same time they were poking him for labs. After seeing his regular pediatrician I was notified that the levels were never high enough for him to have suffered any of the treatment that was given against my wishes repeatedly!!!! I even asked if I could sign an AMA form to have my son released. We were treated as prisoners with no regard this being my child and I not agree with treatment. text: My 2 year old grandson was admitted into the e.r. with a 102 degree fever. The e.r. doctor was rude and told my daughter in law he did not know what to do since he just had a fever. 530 am at 1030 am she is able to get him in to see his soon to be pediatrician. They swabbed him and it comes back that he has strep throat. How could a e.r. supposedly doctor not know to do a simple swab test? Do not take your babies to this e.r..

name: Joseph Land
text:
Andalusia, we have a problem. And it’s a big one.

On Monday (May 20,, 2019), my brother had an outbreak of Cellulitis, a bacterial skin infection that he has had since college. When he has a Cellulitis outbreak, he has to get medical attention immediately because it is a life-threatening infection that can spread into your lymph nodes and bloodstream quickly. Every single time he has had an issue, we have rushed him to the ER. Nearly every time he has been admitted for anywhere between 2 and 10 days. It is a serious condition.

Will is a truck driver. He was out to pick up a load when he came down with this infection and was so sick that he had to have a stranger take him to the ER at Andalusia Health. Typically, the ER nurses recognize the severity and get to him quickly. Not Andalusia Health. M the waiting room quickly, it was three hours before any medication was administered. Since he was on the road – and has insurance – he requested that they admit him for the night so he could regain his strength and get enough medicine in his system to get back home so he could see his doctor. Remember, he had to drive an 18-wheeler all the way back home. The ER staff at Andalusia Health knew this. They refused to admit him, telling him he “didn’t fit the criteria.” Please, can someone explain what criteria one must fit to be admitted into this hospital? Is it the Harvard of hospitals? He was extremely ill and had insurance. This should have been handled immediately.

While he arrived at the ER midday, since he didn’t get to see anyone until late, my mom called the ER to explain his medical history since they would not be able to contact Will’s regular doctor. The nurse she was talking to hung up on her mid-story. And, as Will was getting his bearings and getting dressed to go back to his truck to sleep for the night, he wasn’t fast enough for one of the nurses who told him – and I quote – “I know you aren’t feeling well, but you have to go. We need the bed.” Is Andalusia Health a Level 1 trauma center? The ER in a town of 8,787 (as of 2017) is that busy? The hospital has 88 rooms. Was 10% of the town so sick they needed to be in the hospital? I’m asking. No, seriously, I am asking. Someone please tell me.

Andalusia may or may not have Uber drivers, but my brother couldn’t find one. Nor a cab company. He had to call central dispatch and have a police officer take him back to his truck, where he slept overnight, with Cellulitis raging in his body. Without any medical attention. Because Andalusia Health failed. Big time. I don’t know who was on duty other than Sara Purvis, the certified nurse practitioner who saw him. But, I know that Kim Carol is the ER manager. I know that Amy Herrington is the director. I know that every time I have gone to their website, they boast the wait time being 30 minutes or less. I know that they claim to have “experienced” ER physicians and staff. I know that they failed to live up to that promise. I know that I expect a call from Kohen Johns Brannon today. I know that someone needs to clarify what happened and why it happened. I know that my brother is still sick and sitting in a truck in Andalusia, Alabama right now.

name: Secret Squirrel
text:
Horrible care facility. I entered the facility with my left index finger sliced open to the bone. I waited for over an hour and a half to be seen. Finally was put into a room just to watch TV for another hour. Finally a person come into the room to tell me there was nothing they could do for my cut. They sent me packing with some gauze and tape and told me to keep it clean. Days later it started to smell so I went to a real care facility that actually stitched my finger up. It healed but I no longer have feeling from the cut to my finger tip.

I received a bill for $275 a month later. I called and explained that they did nothing for me. A review was supposedly opened to explore the case. I was never apprised of the findings until a creditor called me to collect the money. Here I sit deployed in the desert of Iraq while my wife and kids are home worried about a debt collection.

I will be getting a lawyer to fight this!

text: Great people - Hospital had a name change in 2016, now Andalusia Health

name: Johnny Wilson
text: First impressions could be nice.  My wife is a diabetic with extensive conditions.  We have been to several hospitals on her behalf for extended stays.  The Andalusia Hospital was not only ill prepared to handle her condition when she was having a glucose low and her body was in the early stages of shutting down, but they immediately upon taking her back, which took 18 mins while gasping for air literally, cut her new shirt off even after we told them why she was short on air (diabetic ketoacidosis) and they did not listen at all, refused to listen, cut her shirt off even when she was able and we offered to take it off, then they refused to replace it!  They had the night Doctor to come see her and he said he was not able to help and he was calling another doctor, then after 20 more minutes we were informed that yes Andalusia Hospital was UNABLE to treat this condition, a common diabetic condition.  We had to leave that hospital, since they wanted to charge us for an ambulance trip to Pensacola FL, I drove faster and called the police depts ahead of my way and had no problem the entire way speeding very quickly, and she was treated immediately at the Pensacola Sacred Heart Hospital.  I will not return to Andalusia Hospital unless I have NO options.

name: Bobby Burke
text: Wish I could give a zero they didn't even check me out all they care about is money and these people are so rude

name: Theresa Noll
text: Slow emergency room, nurses that don't know, doctors that don't care

name: colton schofield
text: Been here five hours

name: Jennifer Kelley
text: Do yourself a favor and drive 30 minutes to an hour and get REAL medical care.  NO STARS!!!!!!  There should be a Zero Star rating!!!!!!!!

name: Mike Jackson
text: They came to me when I was icu telling me I owe them money and I need to pay it and I gave them my credit card and paid and at the time my family was there listen to what they done to me and she said she was only doing what her boss told her to do ....Now I find out they broke some laws took money when I was dope up now they wait till I was on drugs and ask me for money how do I know what they done to me after they put me out can some please tell me ?

name: Nick Conner
text: Worst Hospital ive ever been to! An absolute joke...Had a motorcycle accident and with intense back pain went to ER at 330am..I WAS THE ONLY PERSON THERE!!!.Sat in the room for an HOUR until I finally get xrays and see the doctor and he says I have a contusion which he prescribed a worthless Muscle relaxer and Ibuprofen??...meanwhile im still in pain and can barely sit on the toilet and they wont give me anything for pain...Thanks for nothing Andalusia Health...

name: John Kelley
text: Took my girlfriend to this place with a hurt hip Dr never let me back with her then sent her home with no meds I call today they told me to bring her back in I can't move her they just want more money witch is b's

name: mAtom “Ash” West
text:
**Updated 19 July, after contact from hospital, information at the end of this post.**
We have lived in the area on and off several times due to military orders and have always used Flowers. What was once a clean, hospitable place now reminds us of the setting for a post-apocalyptic video game. The floors in the entrance and waiting room look more like the floors in an old garage. The receptionists (this visit) were very unprofessional, one even walked through the waiting room of patients without a mask. To add insult to filth, the floor in the room they put my step-father in was covered in old needle caps, the "clean" gowns/ sheets hanging from the cupboard were touching the dirty floor and there was even a skittle on the floor near more needle caps. The fact that we have been here for roughly 4 hours isn't the issue (yes, I'm writing it from the room at 0125 in the morning). The issue is that I'm worried that the Waffle House we went to while waiting has been sanitized more recently than this place.
Update (0223 am): Still here, still looks like a cross between a construction zone and a crime scene but finally had an encounter with one nice receptionist.
However, the reason for this edit was something my husband and I saw while waking out of the Emergency Room.
A nurse was wheeling a very old person, whom was lying in the fetal position, from one room down the hall, filled with carts and random things, to their original room. During this time she banged the stretcher into many of the carts and walls. While hitting one cart, something that resembles an air pump regulator, fell from the shelf onto the old person. The nurse casually pushed it back onto the shelf and continued on without even checking on the person, continuing to bang them into the same shelf again. This speaks volumes for the disarray and clutter but broke my heart to see.

19 July Update:
I was contacted via email requesting a verbal conversation the day after my first post. I spoke to a representative for the hospital/ nurses/ E.R. The woman I spoke with seemed genuinely concerned with the issues I brought up. She assured me that they have the same expectations that we do regarding emergency room visits, no matter how many people were admitted.
I can't yet change my review or rating, but I hope to have some proof in the future regarding the things she and I spoke of. That way I can continue to, honestly and with a clean conscience, recommend Flowers to others.

resp.text: We are sorry to learn that your family did not have a positive experience at our hospital, but we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. Our leadership team would like to reach out to you to get more details so we can be sure to address these issues appropriately. If you don't mind someone reaching out, please send your contact information to marketing@flowershospital.com and we will pass it along to the appropriate person on our leadership team. You may also call our Nursing Administration department at (334) 794-5000, ext. 1110. Thank you again for your feedback.

name: Chiani Delilly
text: Man where do I even start  , I Just moved to Dothan , and this is my first time having to go to the Er, because of my diabetes, I went so they can check my sugar because I was scared that my glucose monitor was giving me a bad reading (it wasn’t) but I wanted to be sure my sugar was good , I went in talk to the nurses who was so nice answered all my questions was very playful 😂 and funny and just all and all caring it did take a while for the doctor to come but hey it’s not always gonna go at your speed , but the nurses check on me at all times just wonderful experience,  most recent review 05/31/2021

resp.text: We love to hear about positive experiences, so thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback! And, welcome to Dothan!

name: Patrick Yarcso
text: I went to the er last night with severe abdominal pain. The wait to be seen was not bad. Nurse kelsie and doctor Salna,did an amazing job. Thank you very much.

name: jena bolt
text: Horrible experience will go into detail later depending on outcome of Director response to the situation please stay tuned!!!!!!!

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear of anything less than satisfactory experiences, and we will follow up with our director to ensure any concerns are being addressed. If you would like to provide any additional feedback, please send it to marketing@flowershospital.com and we will pass it along to the appropriate member of our team.

name: Rosalyn Jackson
text:
I just called up to Flowers hospital to check on my friend because she was in so much pain and hadn't been seen in the back for over an hour. The lady was so rude telling me that it was other patients in the back that had been there longer than my friend. So I said, "well y'all need to go check on them too."
She got mad, started to argue and hung up in my face. I was calling because I was concerned and they hot smart with me and was beyond rude. This hospital needs to hire people with compassion.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to help investigate and will address these types of experiences with our team.

name: Deborah Isler Mercer
text: My 88 year-old mother was taken to the emergency room this afternoon by ambulance. Thank goodness things were not nearly as bad as what we had thought. They were super quick on running all the scans, blood work and anything else they thought she might need. Everyone we came in contact with was super nice and very professional! Dr. Day was exceptional! He came in and explained everything to us in great detail. He answered every single question we had and in a language that we could understand! Can't get much better! 😊

name: Nicole Riley
text: Been here 3 hr and my y year old has apenditis systoms and still not back in room

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  It is disappointing to learn when experiences are not positive, and we take such feedback as an opportunity to improve.

name: kacie conner
text:
I was at Flowers hospital emergency department on Friday 2-14-2020. I arrived at 10:15a.m. and wasn't treated until almost 2 p.m. The only reason that I was sent to the ER was because I am pregnant and my OBGYN couldn't give me fluids in their office. When the nurse finally got to me they hooked me up to an IV and to Reglan and put me in a waiting room with no nurse call button or a phone to reach the nurses station. So I started having a reaction to the Reglan and I couldnt get any help. I stood in the waiting room in the back of the emergency room and called for a nurse for 15 minutes and no one came... I finally just removed my IV and left the hospital.
The nurse (Courtney) then called my spouse and stated that they had to take priority patients first and that a pregnant woman who is dehydrated was not priority. I have reached out to Amanda the director of the emergency department with no return calls.

name: Ashley
text: Good experience had both kids there nurses very nice and sweet er could be faster

name: Wanda Speh
text: Extremely long wait! 4 hours and 45 minutes to get labs and 1 bag of fluids

name: Katie D
text:
The wait time wasnt as long as i expected (longest wait was in the private room)
Everyone here was friendly, sympathetic and helpful. The entire facility is really clean and nice. Thank you guys for helping me get back on the road to feeling better. You are appreciated.

name: Lee Lee
text: Thank You for taking good care of my Mother.

text: I Had A Bad Experience On Yesterday At Mobile Infirmary I Had Fallen And I Was A Little Weak So I Had A Nurse Practitioner To Wait On Me Instead Of The Doctor Well Here Goes The Story The Nurse Practitioner Said You Have Had This Before And You Was Here In February For The Same Thing. Now Some Body Please Tell Me What Yesterday Has To Do With February. Mobile Infirmary Really Need To Do Some More Training For Their Nurse Practitioners Because Some Nurse Practitioners And Nurses Don't Know How To Talk To Patients I Don't Really Recommend.

name: Presley Pierce
text: Sunday night I came in with severe abdominal pain,  they got me right in and got my pain under control. Sadly ended up being admitted and scheduled to have my gall bladder removed. The surgery went well, the stay was pleasant and the staff was friendly.  Plus for a hospital the food really wasn't too bad.

name: Nikki Franks
text: Mobile infirmary had the most fastest driest uncaring emergency room attendants ever . My room has been a hallway. They had 2 rooms open and I didn't get any one of them . Then when I asked for a charge nurse a nurse gonna tell me I'm busy later. I've been here since 12 I've had blood drawn since 1 and haven't gotten those results I had an ultrasound done the crnp just came by and told me you have gall stones... Mind you in still in the hallway. There is no such thing as a HIPAA policy here I guess.

name: Goddbod. Junya “iceberg” Winston
text: quick service...

text: This place is one of the worst emergency rooms iv been to ... they didn't even ask my level of pain ... took the lady twice to get an IV in me ... gave me medicine That didn't even work I'm still in pain and I had to ask what was going on with me ... The lady was just gonna discharge me without me knowing what was going on ... gave me ibprofen for kindny stones and told me that is what they give for it but I've had them before and knowing the stuff doesn't work for that ... terrible place I guess I should of went to Providence hospital

text: I had the best experience! I did not have to wait long at all, which was great! The staff was very quick and efficient. Definitely recommend!

resp.text: Hello, Erin. We appreciate you taking the time to share your ER experience. Our team works hard to provide quality, efficient emergency care, and we're glad to know that we hit the mark during your visit. Thank you for choosing Madison Hospital!

name: Paige Pearson
text: There was no communication among nurses and they’d tried to get 2 different urine and blood samples thinking I hadn’t given one until I’d clarified. That being said, the nurses are kind but the front desk staff needs work. Wait time is always horrible here (been 2x now). If I ever (fingers crossed) need medical assistance again, I’ll be sure to travel to Huntsville—far more proficient I’ve been told.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Pearson. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feedback is very important to us, and we will share your comments with hospital leadership. Please call us at (256) 265-9449 so we can address your concerns directly. We look forward to speaking with you.

name: Alexandra Pickle
text:
The actual care is pretty good, very good nurses and doctors are not bad.

The wait time is really bad. I spent 6 hours yesterday there.

This is just a regular day, nothing special. Not even crowded.

I cant’t even imagine what it would be like during pandemic.  People will probably be dropping like flies in the waiting room at this rate.

text: The white lady at the front with her hair parted on the side of her head  and the oval man with no watch just the bracelet, are horrible staff. When I come into an emergency i expect to be taken care of and that is not what happened. We come in with no direction and see a stack of papers so we pick one up and the lady just stares and says nothing. so we ask is this the paper we need to be filling out and she says yes. then the oval man comes out of nowhere and just snatches the sheet as i’m writing and tells me that I don’t listen very well. When the directions were never given to begin with. I expect better from this hospital smh

name: Ciarra White
text: i have been here for almost 7 hours, for a friends foot bc we thought she had broken it. took them 2 hours to even get her in a room and when i went to ask about a x-ray they asked why we hadn’t done it yet even though it was there job. then on top of that the doctor looked at her foot and said it’s probably not broken before he even looked at the x-rays.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. White. We are very sorry to hear about this and appreciate you bringing it to our attention. Please ask your friend to call (256) 265-9449 or send an email to mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org so we can personally address her concerns. Thank you.

name: James Swanson
text:
The nursing staff here is absolutely incredible. They always go above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and answer my questions.
It’s very hit of miss with the doctors. I have chronic kidney stones (which I can usually pass at home) but I do have to go in somewhat frequently because the pain gets absolutely unbearable. I’ve had some doctors straight call me a drug seeker (which I am not) and others simply prescribe me Motrin (which I had explained I had taken at home and it did not work). Those particular ones have a penchant for making you feel more like a nuisance, than someone coming in seeking help.
On the flip side, I have had a few outstanding doctors who have actually listened to what I’ve said and were proactive in my treatment. Unfortunately this is the closest ER to me and I continue to return. The nurses seriously make my stay bearable and deserve all the praise. I get that our doctors are overworked and whatnot, but the care of patients is a privilege, not a right. Huntsville Hospital is just as bad and Crestwood isn’t much better.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Swanson. Your feedback is very important to us, and we will share these comments with ER leadership. Our hospital President Mary Lynne Wright would also be interested in hearing more about your concerns and your impressions of our emergency care. She is best reached by email at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org. Thank you.

name: Nathan Mason
text: Awesome experience! My new go to for emergency medical care. Excellent treatment. Short wait time- only 1 hour.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Mason. We strive to provide excellent emergency care with minimal wait times, so we are proud to have hit the mark during your visit. Thank you for the great review -- and thank you for choosing Madison Hospital!

name: Sadie Lynch
text: Came to Madison er today for some pain everyone was very welcoming greeted me with a smile can’t remember doctors name but she was awesome the tech and everyone that worked in triage was very nice as well the doctor definitely listened and answer my questions and made sure I understood before I left definitely deserves 5 stars 😊

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Lynch. That's great to hear - thank you for sharing. We will make sure that everyone involved in your care sees your message and knows how much you appreciated their efforts.

name: Elizabeth Brown
text: There are some great staff, and there are some truly unprofessional and unpleasant staff. The night intake staff may need some work on compassion

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Brown. We appreciate your feedback and will share your comments with hospital leadership. Please give us a call at (256) 265-9449 so we can learn more about your visit. We look forward to speaking with you.

name: Shanika Ogburn
text: I was not only apprehensive, I was scared to go this facility after reading previous. I thank God I didn't have those experiences. I received exceptional care from all but one person I interacted with while there. Everyone was friendly, professional and caring. I was checked on often, and had all the tests accomplished that I felt were necessary to rule out certain  things and ease my mind. The medication prescribed for me was accurate and healed the pain. I definitely feel comfortable returning if necessary.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your opinions of our Emergency Department, Ms. Ogburn. We are glad to have exceeded your expectations. The overwhelming majority of our patients tell us they are highly satisfied with their care. If for any reason a patient has a negative experience, our staff and administration is committed to fixing the problem.

name: Brianna Best
text: I went in last night to the ER for shortness of breath, chest pains, I had for a few days, and just all around was being pretty concerned. I have never been in an ER before, and oh my gosh I was very impressed. I was SO scared, and they took great care of me. When my heart rate started rising the nurse came in and talked with me for a little bit, and was just asking why I was scared. She calmed me down, and asked if I wanted my phone, and handed it to me. I swear I told every single person I was scared. They made sure to take an EKG, a chest X-ray, the whole deal. Dr. William Young is a gift to them. He was so friendly, threw in a little humor once he was seeing my condition improving, and just very personable. He made sure to go over everything with me, and try to put me at ease. I can’t tell you again how terrified I was being there for the first time. Every nurse that interacted with me/put hands on me for IV or whatever it was, was so friendly. I feel bad I don’t remember all their names. The one I do remember I think his name was Jediah? He came in as the shift changed. I’m sorry if that’s not correct. He’s the last person who saw me, he was very friendly, professional, comforting, and just so so nice. I am so thankful my first experience in my time of complete panic was here with them. They made such an impression on me. Thank you Jediah (I hope that’s your name 😅) and Dr. Young and everyone else who was working that shift. You are amazing! Even the transporter who took me to X-ray was amazing (I was shaking so bad in fear, and she was just so nice positioning me etc for the X-ray). Can’t recommend enough this place! My husband did come, and ask to see me, but was informed no due to covid. I understand, it just sucked because I didn’t want to be alone. Anyway, thanks again everyone!

resp.text: Hello, Mrs. Best. First off, we hope you are feeling much better today. Secondly, thank you so much for taking  the time to let others know about your visit. We're so happy to hear that our team made your very first ER visit less scary than you had feared. We promise to pass along your compliments to Dr. Young, Jedidiah and the rest of the ER team.

name: Keisha Pomares
text: They did such a good taking care of my son!

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Pomares. That's great to hear! We appreciate the kind words and 5-star review. Thank you for choosing Madison Hospital.

name: Dacyndle wix
text: Everytime I have to go to this er I never leave upset. Best staff and wonderful facility my family and I are always taken care of well.

resp.text: We sincerely appreciate the 5-star review! Our ER team will enjoy seeing your comments.

name: Jason Sherrill
text: Wife is in the hospital now for non covid issues and I can’t even be there with her.  If a patient has no covid issues a loved one should be able to be there with them while there in the hospital and not be alone. Ridiculous

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Sherrill. Your feedback is very important to us, and we will let hospital leadership know about your frustration with the visitation policy. If you would like to talk with someone about your concerns, please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449.

name: Wade Wilson
text: Thank you for the excellent care.  I was seen quickly, had lab work and a chest X-ray and felt like I knew what to do once I was discharged.  Everyone I encountered was kind and helpful.  Keep up the good work.

resp.text: We apologize for the delay acknowledging your review, Wade. It's great to know that you had a 5-star visit. Thank you for sharing.

name: Tracey Thomas
text: I didn’t have a long waiting room wait and I cannot say enough good things about nurse Allie.

resp.text: Hello, and thank you for the great review! We're so pleased to know that you had a 5-star experience thanks to Nurse Allie. We will make sure she knows what a difference she made during your stay in the ER.

name: Kristen Dailey
text: The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the room I was in was kind of dirty especially considering cleanliness at this time is imperative! When I was in the waiting room they told me to wait a minute while they cleaned a room, I went to use the restroom in my room and there were some sort of bodily fluids on the floor and the toilet... They said they would clean it or move me to another room but never did. The trash can in my ER room was overflowing. *The staff and how quickly my visit moved along was amazing! I was treated well, and for everything I had done was probably the quickest ER visit ever. For that I'd give 5 stars! Great Dr. and nurses!

resp.text: Thank you taking the time to review us, Ms. Dailey. We apologize that the cleanliness of the ER was not up to our usual standards at the time of your visit. We pride ourselves on a clean, germ-free environment and hope that will be evident to you on your next visit.

name: Carole Albyn
text: Horrible phone experience, trying to figure out any shred of information. Sad.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Albyn. We apologize for your frustrations. Please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449 so we can find out more about your information request and how we can help.

name: Olivia Keel
text: If I could leave a zero I would. They first did not provide any first aid except to keep blood from dropping on their floor.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Keel. We are sorry to hear that your ER visit did not go well. Our hospital President Mary Lynne Wright would welcome the chance to personally address your concerns. She is best reached by email at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org.

name: Jessica Tollefson
text: I'm baffled by the low Google rating. I think the saying "you cannot please everyone" applies here. For me, this was, hands down, the best emergency room experience I have ever had. Thankfully, what I went in for ended up being a misdiagnosis from a doctor I had seen earlier that day. A HUGE thank you to Nurse Alina and Nurse Haley. I hope you ladies see this review. You were both so kind, genuine, and professional. I had a great time chatting with Nurse Alina. She made me feel at ease in what could've been a bad situation. Another HUGE thank you to Dr. Michael Proctor. He displayed the utmost professionalism and kindness. I definitely appreciated how thorough he was. Unfortunately, I don't remember the MRI technician's name (Ashley, maybe? So sorry!), but she was incredibly sweet and had a very calming presence about her, which was much appreciated. Overall, an excellent facility and I would ABSOLUTELY recommend to family, friends, and complete strangers.

resp.text: Ms. Tollefson, thank you so much for your kind words and the five-star rating. We really appreciate the review and will be sure to pass it along to our team.

name: Carl Johnson
text: Took longer then i had expected in the ER. But all around the staff was real cool.

resp.text: We apologize for your wait, Mr. Johnson, but are glad that you noticed the positive attitude of our ER team. Thank you for allowing us to care for you.

name: Lansten Conner
text: Wish there was an option for no star, worst emergency room I’ve ever been to. Sit there for 3 hours. Was only One person in lobby when I arrived I ended up just walking out and going somewhere else because several other patients were taken back before me. DONT recommend

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear about this. Our Hospital President Mary Lynne Wright would welcome the opportunity to speak with you and address your concerns. She is best reached by email at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org.

name: 27jsteve

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and the 5-star review! We appreciate your support.

name: Annie Fuqua
text:
My husband and I had to rush our 2yo daughter to the emergency room in the middle of the night this week. The staff went above and beyond for us. They were very kind to my daughter, and they treated us with respect. They were able to diagnose her illness quickly and got her some much needed relief. They even gave her a doll to comfort her.
I couldn't have asked for a better experience in such a scary situation.
