name: Michelle Bradford
text: My elderly dad has been to this ER twice and the staff are excellent. Getting to see a good doctor is the luck of the draw. The first time, the doctor was very professional, caring, and informative. The second time was an opposite experience. The wait was long, but 95% of the people being seen were non-urgent.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Bradford. We appreciate your feedback. We use patient and family feedback to improve our services.

name: bill mcdole
text: I only give this hospital a 1/2 star but it won't let me the nursing staff is extremely nice but as far as the quality of health care goes they are not worth sending a dog to. They don't care about the patients whatsoever. By far one of the worst hospitals around. I will never make the mistake of coming back to this place again. I recommend that you take the extra time and fuel to go to the main huntsville hospital or Crestwood..

resp.text: Mr. McDole, please consider calling the Patient Advocate so we may learn more about your concerns. Patient & family feedback help us improve our services. The Advocate may be reached at (256) 265-9449.

name: Sheila
text: SMH! 9 hours and nothing. I left the same way I went in. While waiting in room to be seen, I overheard nurses talking negatively about other coworkers and patients. Also, I understand the ER was filled with sick people, it did not warrant the disorganization and lack of professionalism. The front/sign in staff were kind, patient and professional

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Fore-Williams. We're sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience. Your feedback is important to helping us improve our services, and we will make sure the ER Director sees your message. If you would like to speak with someone about your ER visit, please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449. The advocate works closely with our medical staff to address patient concerns. Thank you.

name: Janice Clack
text: If I could give this ER experience a 0, I would. My husband was brought in by ambulance because he collapsed at home and couldn't stand or keep his balance. After about an hour and a half, the "doctor" came in and said all vitals looked OK except high blood pressure. Gave him various medications to lower his BP and told me it was alcohol causing his issues, even though the blood test showed nothing. She was ready to send him home and argued with me because I knew it wasn't alcohol. Long story short, he was diagnosed with having two active strokes, and the worst thing for his situation was to lower his blood pressure!!! He's in rehab now trying to recover his lost abilities. Sorry, Madison ER...you have a nice, new facility, but you need MDs that know the basics of health care. Never again!!!

resp.text: Hello, Mrs. Clack. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We would like to work with you to address your concerns. Mary Lynne Wright, our hospital president, can be reached at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org. If you would rather speak with the Patient Advocate, that number is (256) 265-9449. The advocate works closely with our medical staff to try to resolve concerns from patients and family members.

name: Marvin Austin
text: This place doesn't even deserve a star. We came in because it was the closest hospital and my husband was having severe pain abdominal pain so bad he couldn't breath.  He had to wait 2 HOURS to even be seen when there was almost no one there! There were maybe 7 people in the waiting room and tons of empty rooms in the back.  They FINALLY did an ultra sound and determined he had severe gallstones that could be life threatening and will definitely be as it could rupture any time really and multiple stomache ulcers and in infection in his gi tract. What did they do for him? NOTHING not even a ******* motrin or ANY PAIN RELIEFE Not even a referral no nothing. They told him to go to a Stomache specialist when he gets insurance which he won't have for 2 more months from his job,  that's why they didn't treat him at all!! How can they be so cruel it's disgusting!!He is in bed now covered in sweat and I am praying to God that he won't die.  THE LADY  DOCTOR WHO DID NOT EVEN INTRODUCE HERSELF SO I DONT KNOW HER NAME  WAS RUDE TO ME AND DID NOTHING TO HELP HIM. SHE SHOULD NOT BE A DOCTOR ESPECIALLY NOT IN AN ER. This place is not a hospital it's a joke!!! I'm wil not hesitate to seek legal justice if he has any complications from their negligence!

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you were frustrated with your experience. Please consider reaching out to the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449 so we may properly address your concerns. The advocate works directly with our clinical teams to address patient and family concerns.

name: Keith Hearn
text: Horrible, just horrible.  7 hours in the ER, well probably be longer still here. Doc just left the room and said next time we will be better.  Even she knew it was bad.  And the staff was horrible, nurse started IV on my daughter shot blood all over her arm and floor.  Came in three different times to do paperwork, computer was down and blamed it on their new software One Chart.  Will not be back to HH in Madison or Huntsville.  Crestwood for now on.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Hearn. We're very sorry to hear that you and your daughter had a bad experience in our ER. We are transitioning to a new electronic medical record system as you mentioned, but the needs of our patients should always come first. We have shared your message with Madison Hospital President Mary Lynne Wright, and she would be happy to speak with you. Her email is mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org. Thank you.

name: CherryPaints
text: Worst place. My bf rushed in before 4pm over chest pain and heart problems. He got xrays and blood work done and then waited in the waiting room for 4 hours. I politely asked what we were waiting on after 2 hours and one of the staff snapped saying "a bed." After we got a room they gave us no answer other than telling us the simple check ups for his blood.... they told us to come back when he has pain so they can get it when it happens.. we did that last night, yet waited for 4 hours. Not a single person who came in before or after us waited that long. We didnt get out until past 8. I'm glad we we're treated like we were overreacting. Never coming back

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that we fell short of your expectations. Your feedback is important to us, and we invite you to contact the Patient Advocate so we may properly address your concerns with our clinical team. The advocate can be reached at (256) 265-9449 during normal business hours. Thank you.

name: Jennifer League
text: I had to take my 8 year old son to the ER last night 11/15/17 because of his explosive anger issues. He wouldn't walk on his own so a couple of the nurses or medical staff had to carry him back to the room. It was about 2 hours before the Doctor came in and I was not pleased with him at all. He hardly said anything to me or my son and left the room never to be seen again. It was another 2 hours (10:30 pm) before the on screen psychologist talked with me. By this time, my son was already asleep. They didn't take any labs or urine so nothing got ruled out. The Dr Swan would not entertain this issue being physical in nature but purely behavioral. It seems to me that if I have to bring my son to the ER they should rule out all possibilities before discharge. I left there with no answers but see your psychiatrist as follow-up. WTH?? What happened to critical thinking and ruling out things before jumping to conclusions? Why didn't you take a urine sample or blood? What if he had been exposed to something while at school that I don't know about? Truly disappointed by this visit. My son is experiencing something which only started about 6 months ago. Another thing, my son urinates a lot and seems to have incontinence. He has wet the bed and soiled himself on a regular basis since he turned 8 years old. He never had this problem before. I mentioned this to the ER staff but nothing else was done. When he fell asleep he did wet the bed in the ER. He has had to wear Under Jammies at night now for about 5 or 6 months. I know he uses the restroom a lot at school as well. I really need answers as to what is going on with my child.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. League. We're sorry to hear that your ER visit didn't go as you expected. Customer feedback is a vital part of our efforts to improve our services, and we will share your concerns with ER and hospital leadership. If you would like to speak with someone about your son's ER visit, please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449 during regular business hours. The advocate works directly with our medical staff to try to resolve patient issues.

name: Vaughn Ammons
text: I wish I could give 0 Stars,very dismissive about my wife's condition and she is a RN herself

resp.text: We're sorry to read these comments, Mr. Ammons. Madison Hospital President Mary Lynne Wright would welcome the opportunity to speak with you about your concerns. She is best reached by email at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org.

name: Teresa Lopez Mandalas
text: If you notice a pattern with the African American patients/ None Caucasian patients all HAVE COMPLAINTS. THE STAFF AND PATIENT ADVOCACY IS FULLY AWARE OF THESE ISSUES OF STEREOTYPING AND RACIAL BIAS IN THIS HOSPITAL. MY DAUGHTER WAS BORN IN THIS HOSPITAL NOT ONE NURSE OR DOCTOR ACKNOWLEDGE ME AS THE FATHER, DIDNT PUT MY NAME ON THE CARD. NOTHING. BLANTANT DISREPECT. I DONT CARE WHAT HAPPENS IN LIFE I WILL MAKE A MOCKERY OF THIS HOSPITAL AND POSSIBLE LAWSUIT. IF YOUR A BLACK PATIENT, VIDEO AND OR AUDIO RECORD YOUR WHOLE EXPERIENCE AT THIS HOSPITAL. MY FIANCE JUST LEFT THIS HOSPITAL CAME IN WITH HER BLOOD PRESSURE 180 OVER 110. WAITED 3 HOURS BECAUSE THE ONLY THING THEY CARED ABOUT WAS A URINE SAMPLE, THEN RUSHED HER OUT IN 20 MINS AFTER CALLING HER TO THE BACK. GAVE HER MEDICATION SHE NOR OUR FAMILY SUPPOSE TO HAVE BECAUSE OF FAMILY HEART CONDITIONS HISTORY (DID THEY ASK. NO. BUT DID THEY PUT IT IN THE SYSTEM LIKE THEY ASKED. YES). DID NOT CHECK HER BLOOD PRESSURE BEFORE LEAVING. SHE IS 25 YEARS OLD AND SHE STATED SHE FELT LIKE THEY TREATED HER LIKE SHE WAS FAKING HER ISSUE. ITS POLICY TO CHECK YOUR BP BEFORE LEAVING. THEN I CALLED THE HOSPITAL 10 MINS AGO AND RECOREDED THAT CALL AND THE LADY ELIZABETH IN THE ER AUGUST 29TH 2018 HAD A ATTITUDE. KEEP IN MIND I HAVE THE CALL RECOREDED, SHE ACT LIKE SHE COULDNT EVEN TELL ME THE NUMBER TO PATIENT ADVOCACY OR EVEN THE NAME OF THE DEPARTMENT. I PRAY NO ONE DIES AND SUE YOU GUYS OUT OF A HOSPITAL. HOPEFULLY ALL THE STAFF KIDS GET TREATED THIS WAY IN LIFE AT HOSPITALS. JUST A LITTLE HEADS UP, BECAUSE OF WHERE I WORK WE WILL MAKE THIS KNOWN AND HAVE PATIENTS COME IN WITH REAL PROBLEMS RECORDING THEIR WHOLE EXPERIENCE SO SLOWLY BUT SURELY YOUR STAFF WILL GET FIRED ONE BY ONE. ITS 2018 AND IF YOUR STILL RACIST YOU HAVE A MENTAL DISABILITY CALLED RETARDATION OF THE BRAIN, CATCH UP WITH THE REST OF THE WORLD RACISM IS NOT OF THE POPULAR TREND OR OPINION ANYMORE, TREAT YOUR PATIENTS RIGHT!

resp.text: Mr. Feddy, we are so sorry to hear that you feel this way. Please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449 so that we may properly address your concerns.

name: Trice Scott
text: I love the care I always receive here . The medical staff are very professional and caring.

resp.text: We appreciate your nice comments and the great rating. It's our honor to serve our community.

name: Faith Nuñez
text: I only had to wait 30 minutes before being called into triage, then I waited about 10 minutes to see the nurse practitioner,  I had 2nd degreen burns on my hand so they wanted the doctor to see me , overall I was in and out in 2 and 1/2 hours the staff was caring and friendly the treatment I received was well worth the drive to go . The E.R doctor was very understanding and attentive. I would recommend going here for an Emergency!

resp.text: We are happy to hear that you are satisfied with the care you received while in our Emergency Department. Thank you for the kind words and the nice rating!

name: Micaela Galindo
text: Worst ER in Alabama, had my husband waiting literally 3 hours for a room. And when they finally saw him, the doctor wouldn’t even look him in the eyes when they spoke. The doctor only stayed 10 mins, and didn’t see him again. The nurses are careless and unattractive. Literally the worst. Don’t go. Ever.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your frustrations Mrs. Sabao. Patient and family feedback are used to help us improve our services. If you are interested in speaking with a Patient Advocate, please call (256) 265-9449.The Advocate works with clinical staff to address patient and family concerns.

name: kim bennett
text: The staff were all very kind and friendly.  The doctor was professional.  Overall it was by far the least miserable ER visit I have ever had.  The wait was incredibly short. Thank you HH Madison.

resp.text: Thank you very much for taking the time to review us on Google. While no one likes having to go to the ER, we're pleased to hear that our team provided you with good care.

name: Leslie
text: The doctor threatened to take away my driving privileges if I didn't go thru with the testing she wanted. She was so dramatic.

resp.text: Ms. Tunstill, we appreciate you reaching out to us to share your concerns. We understand that you have spoken with the director of our ER about your visit. If we can be of further assistance, the Patient Advocate can be reached at (256) 265-9449 or customersvc@hhsys.org.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you did not get the care and service that you expected, Ms. Corner. Our Hospital President Mary Lynne Wright would be happy to speak with you about your visit and your concerns. The best way to reach her is by email at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org. Thank you.

name: Janet McTigue
text: I was brought in by ambulance and got to a bed right away. However it was two hours before I saw a doctor with no pain relief. I have polycystic kidney disease and had excruciating pain in my kidney.after 5 hours the doctor told me I had a uti that hadn't got to my kidney yet. Apparently he didn't know much about PKD. I was dismissed with excruciating pain.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. McTigue. We are very sorry to hear that you did not have a good experience. Please give us a call at (256) 265-9449 so we can try to address your concerns directly. Or if you prefer, you can email our hospital president at mary.lynne.wright@hhsys.org. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Anna Pope
text: The nurses and doctors in the er wing are some of the kindest people working. Not feeling well and they treated my son and I with the sweetest and most attentive care! Love them love the work they do. Thank  you for being there today for me it helped more than I was able to say

name: Kathryn Haggerty
text: Some of the people that work there just seem very unhappy to be there or just ready to get off the clock. You ask them a question that is not out of the ordinary and they look at you like your crazy. I would like to think I am being taken care of and by the best possible. Especially coming to the emergency room for serious issues and and large bill that will soon be on the way. Might want to give some of your staff a talk about attitude adjustments. Thanks

name: Mario Torres
text: Wish i could give 0 stars. Went in because my wife is pregnant and was experiencing some bleeding. She waited in ER for about 3 hours before they told her they were full and she needed to go see the OB across the street. She then waited another 3 hours to get the results from the doctor who seemed to have little interest and totally unaware of why we were even there. And the cherry on top was the $6000 dollar bill we received (insurance covered a part of it), but still feel its ridiculous especially due to the lack of service and professionalism we received.

name: Shannon Moore
text: Doctors could care less and are rude

name: Dootsie Williams
text:
I have had to go to the ER at Brookwood hospital twice now in the past several months. I know Brookwood tends to have bad reviews, but I was very pleased both times! i’m sure a lot of it has to do with the timing. Today was Sunday morning around 8 AM and the other time was on a Friday around 6 PM. Both times hardly any wait time . I like that it’s small and doesn’t hold a lot of people and get real crowded like Uab does were you can wait eight hours at UAB .

The doctor that help me the first time was Dr. Kraig Johnson. I could not be more pleased with him! He gets an A+ ++! He talked slowly, looked me straight in the eye, and explained things very clearly. He did not talk over my head. He could not be nicer!!! I’ve been to many ERs with a lot of different people at a lot of different hospitals and seen a lot of different doctors, and this doctor stood out along with this ER department.   I could not have been more pleased with the whole process!  Thank you Brookwood Hospital ER in Homewood and Dr Kraig Johnson .   I wish I had gotten the other doctors names today because they were just as good everybody that worked there super nice.   It seems a lot cleaner than UAB also.  And having target next-door was convenient on getting my prescription filled this time. Last time it was after hours..

name: Bruce Patterson
text: Dr. Johnson saved my father's life.  If we had been 10 minutes later we would have lost him.

name: Alexis Folsom
text:
Never in my life have I been treated as horrible as I was tonight.  Every time I go to brookwood hospital they are always so nice to me and try to get me out of pain as soon as they can, I do go alot for my kidneys but I think I finally have them under control.  Anyway so I went in and the first was normal as always.  After they triage me they took me back to my room and usually I would get changed and they would be a nurse coming in and starting a saline drip but not this time. Nurse comes in and realizes they have the wrong charts and go to try to find me so I thought I would get the iv after that.  Nope still no iv.  So dr comes in and he asks what's going on and I tell him and hes like so it's your kidneys, thinking to myself it's not even in the correct spot for my kidneys but anyway.
I tell him and show him again and he just says ok I'll get you and ultra sound, I asked for something for the pain because I am in some serious pain at this point. He says I have to wait until the ultrasound which I understood because i never had one done and maybe it could alter the scan. Anyway after the scan the dr comes in and tells me i have an ovarian cyst so big it has taken over my ovary and it hurts so bad becasue the ovary has blood flow.  He is still acting as if he really doesnt care, but at that point I'm like yeah so maybe he understands the pain I am in and will give me something for the pain, but he doesnt he tells the nurse too. Well nurse comes in and ask if I have a ride home and tell him I do and then he tells me I can not have anything until.my ride gets there....
Never in my time of going to the er hsve I been told I can not have anything for the pain until someone comes and sits in there with me. This is at 4pm sam doesnt get there until 5pm the nurse doesnt come back until 545pm. So almost 2 hours later I get something that is the equivalent to advil so of course I am still in so much pain and full of anger. I was not told what to do next or what he can do to help me. He told me to go to my ob, which I can not get into for 3 weeks and he knew that because I told him that at the beginning. So brookwood a hospital I have always defending has treated me so terribly and I have no answers and I still am in so much pain and maybe its because it was two men, but then I realize I dont live in a word like that. They just didnt understand the pain I was in because they dont hsve ovaries.
So still no questions answered and I had no miss work today and get to go back tomorrow still in a ton of pain.

name: Luke Dunkling
text: Quick response time

name: Anna Parker
text: The only reason to give 2 stars instead of 1 is because my son got his breathing treatment and got better. That was the only redeeming quality about the visit. Poor communication, poor direction, poor patient care, and no assessment of sons condition prior to discharge. If you have a real emergency, i wouldn’t go there (especially for children)

name: Shena Ward
text: I took my grandmother to Cullman Regional medical center on Tuesday after the hospital had just discharged her on Sunday. This will be long because the whole story shows how incompetent this physician is. My grandmother was in the hospital for almost a week following a colonoscopy from Cullman regional. Her spleen was bumped during the procedure and it caused her to have internal bleeding. After discharge on sunday she was short of breath on a high concentration of oxygen. No matter how much the oxygen was increased she still had extremely low levels. She was hooked to a monitor that measured pulse, oxygen saturation and blood pressure. All these things were all over the place,but Dr. Tighe told me "we dont look at the machines, we look at the patient because the machines are always wrong. She told him her heart was feeling strange and she was struggling bad to breathe, he told us that her oxygen was low because she has COPD and this could be her new normal. I am her primary caretaker and I monitor her closely and I told him this wasn't her normal and begged him to do more tests, or to listen to her at least. But he was satisfied after he ran a urine test and a series of bloodwork. He sent her home. We were home maybe 4 hours before I had to call 911 because she could not breathe we couldn't not get her oxygen over 77, and her blood pressure had skyrocketed. The ambulance took her back to Cullman Regional, she saw another doctor there. He said she was very sick and he didn't know why Dr. Tighe had discharged her. Her lungs were full of blood clots and her heart was struggling to work. She was airlifted to Huntsville. She had clots in several places and her spleen was in terrible shape, it had to be removed. Doctors in Huntsville were afraid to attempt the surgery to remove the clots because they said it would for sure kill her. One of them called a friend of his, an angel of a surgeon who was able to remove the clots and install a vena cava filter. She is still with us today. She is very sick and weak and will heal slowly. She was put on life support because of the damage that was done to her heart and lungs because Dr. Tighe sent her home, without running tests or listening to her lungs or heart when she is having trouble with both. This is patient abuse. I just wanted to warn others, if you have to go to the emergency room at Cullman Regional and Dr. Tighe is working, demand to be transferred. He is a danger to patients.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: They took good care of me late one night.

name: Deborah Cummings
text: I went the CRMC ER because I had fainted and couldn’t breath. My husband rushed me there. There was no one in the waiting room, yet they made me wait. I was taken into a room where the nurse took my blood pressure. It was 205/112. My blood pressure is usually a steady 124/72. They took me to a room and started an IV for fluids. I told them I had been given Toridol earlier that day for a migraine so they gave me another shot of Toridol. No one was being seen except me and a guy in mental lock down. I saw the doctor who didn’t listen to me or my husband. They took a rapid ekg and a chest X-ray. My pulse ox was low. I was never given oxygen. In fact the nurse cane in and said it was ok to go home. Never saw the doctor again. I really felt like I had a mild heart attack. I have been weak every since. Either that or a bad reaction to Toridol which they gave me another dose.

name: Madison Casey
text: They are absolutely awful there! I went in for x-rays was a 100% positive I broke my foot and was in horrible pain! They took x-rays and told me I had a bruise on my foot! I went to an orthopedic surgeon and sure enough he got my x-rays and took more him self and it was broke! Cullman ER doctor sent me away as if I was trying to get pain meds! I just needed relief on my foot to walk!

name: Todd Carter
text: Went in afraid I had appendicitis. Turned out to be kidney stones. Told me to tough it out no biggy except my blood pressure was over 160/120 and was running a fever. They refused to help and was told they are only there to make sure there was nothing life threatening. Very dissatisfied with the care I rescieved and was immediately help by American Family Care. Same as with my son who was diagnosed with Type1 diabetes and was neglected as well until we got to UAB. If you need care for such problems as stitches or something superficial as that they they may be ok but do not count on them for anything important in your life.

name: Brandon Knutson
text: Dr. Christianson was great! He treated our family like his own! First time in a long time cullman has had a good ER physician!

name: Edwin Romero
text: horrible service. took my dad 3 times in less than 2 weeks for an apparent ulcer that was causing his excruciating pain. This last time he sat in the Er for hours without being giving no pain meds at all. Got him to UAB  and he had his pancreas and liver inflamed. sorry of a hospital get actual real doctors in there. and the nurses just sit at the nurses station gossiping about patients. SAD....  DONT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE AND JUST GO DOWN TO REAL DOCTORS IN BIRMINGHAM.

name: Brittan Yeager George
text: If I could leave no stars, I would. I went in completely dehydrated. I had a horrible stomach virus and had just passed out and hit my head causing a knot. I went in at 1am and was the only person in the waiting area. They took me back, started an iv with saline and gave me something for nausea. As soon as the medication entered my veins I became sweaty, nauseous, and my chest felt tight. I explained this to the nurse. He said " uh no, it's suppose to do the opposite. If it doesn't get better, well you something else ".. and he left the room.. for a while. I received not even a quarter of a bag of saline and was sent home dehydrated. I was sick for another week. My legs cramped for days. I usual do not go to this er but, my husband made the executive design saying " I think they can handle this". Apparently not.

name: Jess Gold
text: Place is a dam money scandal an should be shutdown. I cut through two tendons an they just stitched me back wasn't till a week later when I went back that they reliazed hey he might have severed his tendoms.

name: Shirley Stauffer
text: I was in there because I couldn't breathe. They didn't give me no call button for the nurse. The doctor didn't come back in to tell me my test results or anything like that or to see how I was breathing.

name: Jonny Putman
text: Went in for extreme pain. Was charged out the keister and given nothing for it. May they all rot in hell.

name: Danya Martinez
text:
Place never gives a diagnosis.
It’s always unknown.

name: C. Allen
text: Waited over a hour in a room and a nurse never came in AFTER paying a copay. Nobody ever came in so we left. My sister was later admitted the same day to UAB for dehydration. Do not come here under any circumstances.

name: Michael Townson
text: Absolute joke! Don't waste your time!

name: Sarah Capps
text: Always caring people it’s an ER your gonna have to wait sometimes. But great care

name: John Toelaer
text: Arrive for wife's ruptured ovarian cyst. Give list of meds and allergies to triage nurse - lortab causes vomiting as with most people nowadays. See doctor later, doctor knows nothing about patient hasn't looked at chart. Offers ONLY lortab- doesn't care that she's allergic. They DO NOT have access to Huntsville Hospital's records. If they did, they would see that this happened a year ago. Dilaudid was given during that visit which worked(and is fairly commonplace treatment for such) this doctor refused, claiming that lortab is plenty for this. Never once did they do ultrasound to find cyst, just xray (cyst rarely shows on X-ray. She did get checked for appendicitis though. Everything medical as far as diagnosis goes has been off the cuff. Small town egos and little outside knowledge. Don't bring anyone you love here. I am burdened with telling everyone I know that this is 3rd world medicine over here.

name: Siana Powell
text: sometimes there is a long wait-depending on the ambulances that come in, as it should be. Staff is extremely professional and compassionate, especially when I have migraines.

name: Michael Pilkilton
text: Your okay if you don't get Dr Osbourne .she has no clue what is going on check credentials .

name: Gregory Jordan
text: My dad drove to the emergency room and a few days later, they discharged him at 10:00pm after calling a 3rd emergency contact we had listed to tell them he had fallen, after talking and laughing earlier that day, that night he couldn't speak or barely move all the way home and had to take him to st.vincents the next morning, he died a few days later, if you love the person you might be taking to the hospital in the future,  I beg you don't take them to this hospital!!!

name: Wendall D. Graves (Big Daddy Graves)
text: Because I was able to keep on loving and caring for my wifey, because they &I kept her alive. 🤟💯

text:
Emergency Room facility was very filthy the equipment as well as the floors .
I just hurried up and got out of there even though I was sick my surroundings were creepy and a few mosquitoes got on me
while I was there and when I checked in at triage desk.

text: This doctor in particular  ( Fuller ) is great !!

text: If there was a rating for ZERO it would be that for pre registration department. EXTREMELY RUDE and laughed at me because I wanted to update my info for my last name and insurance over the phone. And then laughed at me again when I asked about there location.  EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL

name: Top TierLLC
text: They are sorry and lazy up there and take to long. And the employees are rude. I wouldn’t recommend no one to go there!

My brother’s nurse bless her heart needed to be retired, while able bodied nurses sat at the station gossiping everyone in housekeeping need to have a spatula scraping those hideous floors cleaning top to bottom.

name: ashlee cook
text: I will admit I haven’t heard many good things about them but they were most convenient at the time the one girl at the front that checked me in was quite nice , there was a little of a wait and I thought people that where coming in after me were going in before me but once I got in my room the staff that came in my room were supper comforting and and sweet and I’m glad that everything ended up being okay

name: Richard Horton
text: IN A WORD:  (  NO!  )

name: Jeff dungan
text:
Waited way to long. Was told they didn't have any beds open I wasn't there for a bed only an x-ray. Also very dirty, stuff all over the floor. The cleaning person came by twice and swept up a little bit then moved on.
Will not go back.

name: Susan Martin
text: Been waiting to see a doctor after a head injure. I’ll might not be a real emergency, but 2 hours in waiting room is ridiculous.

name: Ali Almaklani
text: Longest wait ever even when  there was no1 else in the waiting area.

name: william riddle
text: A caring staff

name: Justin Presley
text: It took a total of 4 hours :(

name: Cyndi Hebert
text: We used to love this place, but the doctor tonight has changed my mind. We were treated rudely and beneath her. She had no care in the world about my child and had her mind made up it was depression and not sickness. FYI, he has a brain disease. Smh. Hello Vanderbilt, goodbye Children's.

name: Mindy Tobin
text: This is not a first come first serve hospital..this is a sickest child goes first hospital..thank god..Remembering that time is of the essence in the event of an emergency while you wait is a must.sometimes the sickest baby doesnt look ill at all..oh and..its christmas time !!

name: pedro martinez
text: We have been to many urgent care facilities over the years, but tonight was another level. We had to go the children's. I can not tell you what it meant to us. From the moment we walked in the door, things were different. This is the kind of medical care I heard my mom talk about in the 50's, genuine concern and compassion. We had been to 2 different urgent cares and had gotten the run around, before we finally decided, we need to go downtown to children's. The urgent care facilities' demeanor was negative and "be thankful for what you get". Children's was different. Compassion and loving urgency to get this child some comfort was so obvious. My child immediately relaxed and become a willing patient. In short, he felt their love. Man, that makes a huge difference! Please don't stop being the compassionate and loving medical providers that you are, it makes oceans of difference.

name: Patty Griffith
text: Children’s of Alabama Emergency Room is a place where they will put your mind at ease. Your child or children are in the best care. I have taken my son more than once and never felt so reassured that he would be taken care of like he was one of their children. You can valet your car to avoid the hassle between 16th and 17th street. A great service to make the emergency room trip run smoothly.

name: Drew Mack
text: I am a patient that has had back issues going on for 4 months without a diagnosis.   I went into the ER because I had no way to stop my pain.  I entered the ER around 8:00pm.   I had a very high BP and pain level.   I got called back about 8:30pm and was admitted into the hospital for 5 days.  Thank you Children’s for all of your help.  I will fight through this.

name: McDonald *
text: Wow, ER doctors are so good now they can diagnose a toddler that has had 3 days of temp (currently 104) just by looking at them. NO testing required!!

name: Jack R
text: Eh, it was decent! it took forever for doctors to come, but not bad at all

name: G G
text: The wait was long but the quality of care was worth it.

name: sothonn harbison
text: Don't waste your time- you won't get seen till hours and hours later. By then I could have had my regular pediatrician see my baby. Go to the ER for these signs they say. Very high fever is just another number. No concerns for the vomiting, rapid breathing, hard to breath, seizures, baby turning purple and temperature keeps rising to alarming levels even after medicine, cold rag and bath. And then to be release with a "virus"? Can they be anymore vague?

name: Buddy Skinner
text: The staff, the valet parking make for a pleasant atmosphere upon our arrival at Children’s of AL. ER. The nurses and doctors were all well trained, professional, and also friendly to our child/us.  They listened to him explain his symptoms. Then everything they were doing to treat his illness and get him stabilized. Very comforting knowing such a wonderful, first class facility is located so close to our home. Birmingham is Blessed to have Children’s of AL hospital.

name: Aris Garcia
text: Wonderful staff, they treated my son like he was the only patient...more than a hospital a 5 starts hotel.

name: Alan Thornton
text: My 4 year old nephew waited 4 hours with a neck injury that was hurting him so bad he was shaking. After the 4 hour wait we asked how much longer it would be and was told another 4-5 hours. Meanwhile a guy gets brought in by police in handcuffs cause he got bit by the k9 in the hand trying to run away comes in an hour after us and he got taken straight back. We ended up taking him to another er the next day and when they xray him he had an out of place vertebrae in his neck . But they take in a criminal first... PEICE OF TRASH HOSPITAL

name: shelia wade
text: They quick and they take good care of  Jaylen Bailey when he arrive.

name: Brent Elrod
text: Great place!  They’ve done a lot to help our child.

name: Cristen Greathouse
text: I was sent to children's to get a ct scan after a doctor's x-ray showed something abnormal. My daughter was run a low fever and her white blood cells count was high and she had chest pain a hard time taking a deep breath. When we arrived everything was quick and easy they even give her  medicine to help with the fever . Then we got put in a room the resident doctor can in to tell us that they wasn't doing a ct scan but another x-ray.  I was a little  Confused but ok at 6:30 they took her back for another x-ray she got back at 6:35 . Then the waiting game was on we wanted for a hour for them to tell us she was fine and could go home,but if she started running a fever and having a harder time breathing to bring her back . Then I was really confused.. She was running a fever when we came in and they never  Explained why her white blood cell count was up. But she was fine !! So I guess your telling me my 14yr is making up the chest pain shortness of breath and fever..

name: Ashna S.
text: Love love love this place. The staff are amazing, friendly, gentle, and very caring. The wait can be pretty irritating when your baby is hurting but once they get you back in a room it’s a breeze from there. I had originally taken my daughter to St Vincent’s in Pell City because her doctor had told me to take her there. They were no help. Children’s will always save the day. Thanks so much Children’s hospital.

name: Lythea Brown
text: Worse place I have ever been too! I would not recommend coming here and I want even here for me or my cold I was a friend's driver. But the wait was ridiculous and the front nurses were rude and not helpful and withheld information.

name: Aida Talley
text: The building is beautiful. I did not like the fact that there was a metal detector in a children's hospital. The staff was very nice but we waited for an hour for my daughter to get a room after coming in ambulance then when she was placed in a room we waited two hours and no one every came. One RN said she didn't know we were even in the room. My daughter fainted without warning at a subway while coming from our family vac. She was unconscious shortly but conscious when I arrived. We left the hospital.

name: craig wooden
text: Top notch staff and physicians. Brought my daughter to the ER and had no wait. We went straight to a room and a doctor was in within a few minutes. Everyone was nice and helpful. I would highly recommend Childrens of Alabama.

name: Gus E
text: Our son was transferred here from another hospital bc they couldn’t keep an IV in.  1st try at Children’s, and they get the IV started. Outstanding team.  kudos to all the staff! Very loving and sincere. Simply the best.

name: Kunqi “No longer well rested”
text: Ok i guess. Its really long and the staffs looks like they don't care about their job anymore. I have crohns disease and most of time every time i go to the hospital, they just.. Look at you with dull eyes. Warning the staffs can immediately make you feel unwelcome

name: Holly Fitz
text: 1st time visit to Children's ER around 5pm for high fever and eye swelling following surgery that same morning at 7am. Let me stress to you the shock at walking into this place. When you arrive you hand over your bags to security to be searched and walk through a medical detector. Upon walking in i appalled. The place was disgusting. The floors and chairs were smeared in god knows what and their wasn't a hand sanitizer station visible in the place.  Upon intake my child was given a large dose of Tylenol (even though i had just given him some 2 hours before) the dose was 3.75 ml even though our sheet from pediatrician says weight gets 2.5ml. and he was given a dose of Benadryl and we were sent back to waiting room. After an hour or so we were taken to a room where the billing representative came immediately to collect my 100 copay and then an hour later we saw a resident who snottily corrected me when i called him a nurse. He asked some questions looked him over and left. I didn't see anyone again for hours. I was by myself, my child is an infant and i needed to use the bathroom. the only one was in the hall. The bed had no rails to leave my baby in, there was no nurse visible or that answered the call button to assist and the bathroom had no table to lay him on so i could use the bathroom. After a few hours the doctor comes in with a nurse and informs me that my child is allergic to tape (where they taped his eyes down for surgery that morning) and he has sensitive skin. And that they were going to give him a dose of Benadryl to help the swelling. I said NO you just gave him Benadryl on intake and a very large dose of Tylenol. They were like oh we did? Sorry.. I pointed out that the Benadryl did not help and his eye is looking progressively worse and that if he was allergic to tape wouldn't both eyes be like this?  They informed me they weren't going to do anything or run any tests and to follow-up with regular doctor tomorrow. They would however do a flu test to appease me. I know he doesn't have the flu and after 30 minutes i paged the nurse to ask if we can go home and have the flu results called to doctor the next morning? They said they will tell the nurse and send her in to talk to us. Never showed up. Flash forward another hour and 45 minutes. Flu negative and we can finally go home. Vitals and temp never checked since intake and no bloodwork drawn. Nothing. The next morning my child breaks out in the roseola rash. Thanks for nothing Children's. I'm glad my child wasn't having post-surgery infection. If my baby needs to go back to ER. We'll be going to Grandview.

name: HairByTammy T
text: Top-notch facility & staff! Courteous & very thorough! We appreciate the care my son received tonight!

name: Jennifer Hutchings
text: Just want to let you all know that ur emergency staff last night was horrible...i brought my daughter in cause she hit the door frame and had 2 goose eggs on her head and immediately started throwing up. We also brought it to their attention that she was hurting in her private area. They had us there for 2 hrs and didnt do anything but give her some Motrin. When they said that they weren't going to do a ct scan due to radiation we thought ok well we will be going home in a minute then. They kept us there for 2 hrs with them seeing that she was in pain in her private area and they wouldnt do anything but tell us to get some diaper rash cream. They could have given her something for some relief and was going to keep us for 2 more hrs to watch her for the head condition when it was clear that she was fine with that.  I also told them that she is a symptomatic hemophilia carrier and they did absolutely nothing for her. I had to finally just say let us go so we can go get her something to help with the pain. I had to google what i needed to get for her and leave there and go by CVS in the middle of the night when they could have given her something there. I haven't had many problems from children's before but last night was the 2nd worst experience I've had there. Their job is to make these kids feel better not ignore the symptoms. I could have given Motrin at the house and avoided the hr s that I spent up there FOR ABSOLUTELY NOTHING

name: Demyla Matthewjr
text: My son years old and he sick throwing up bleeding nose been here since 8 still n the waiting room a 11 really sad

name: Shannon S Crenshaw
text: Typically we have good service.  Today I have been waiting for 2 plus hours waiting to be seen by the doctor.  I was told due to my child being sicker then other patients it would take longer.  Not sure of that logic.  Not happy, Life with insurance in America.

name: Carrie Harden
text: My 10 yr old daughter died after 42 days on ECMO. We were told in front of dozens of witnesses there just wasn't nothing left they could do yet when we get her med rec it shows they "resuscitative measures were deemed medically futile although family did not explicitly withdraw care" then at 12pm her pump was reduced to 1 which wasn't life sustaining and no further vitals or any other records were logged after 12pm but she didn't die until 1:24pm. Also none of her meds were given except sedation! Why lie? If she was beyond saving then why lie to our faces?

name: raven prince
text: This visit wasn't so great since the  nurse forgot to give me a sample cup for my daughter which postponed our time by an hour since we had to wait for her to use the bathroom again. Dr. Childress is Amazing! This is my second encounter with him and he has been very nice to us. I was excited when I saw the free valet service but upon leaving they lost a patients vehicle! She had her ticket and they brought her another persons keys asking if they were hers and what type of vehicle was it. It took exactly 10mins for them to bring my vehicle and they were still trying to figure out where the lady Durango was. I would've loved to give them 5 stars but sadly this visit wasn't that great.

name: Jenna Walden
text: I brought my 3 year old in due to a fall. Once we arrived, she started vomiting and couldn't stay conscious. The staff could care less. I walked out to the nurses station to find someone to help my daughter and I was told my nurse was giving someone an IV they would get her to my room. After waiting 2 hours, a lady walks in the room to register us and I still had not seen the nurse or a dr. At that point I got up and walked out with my child and went to another ER where they saw her promptly and ran test. I will NEVER take any of my kids to children's hospital again. Very poor service and you will never see a real doc just a "nurse practioner" if one ever makes it around to your room.

name: Ryan Jones
text: Best emergency department in the state! The care you get here is top notch.

name: Poe Edgar
text: We are still sitting in the ER waiting  room after 2 and a half hours. We did get called back but only to be turned around because "we had to give your room to someone else". If you come bring a lunch and have a friend or family member  on reserve so you can rotate.  We will probably still be here waiting when you arrive.

name: Aries Gates
text: Date of Service: 11/15/2016 @9:15pm Room 16 in E.R. I have had the worst experience in my Life! My son has been having Migraines for the last 8 years & he is 12 yrs old. When you have a child that suffers from this type of pain it hurts my Heart that Dr.Anna White would come & ask questions. Conversation: Dr. Anna White    Kameron what's hurting on you? Kameron replies my head is hurting really bad & my stomach. Dr. Anna White asked: How long has your head been hurting & Kameron replied off & on since last night but my stomach started today. Dr. Anna White then asked have he had any bowel movements & Kameron replied: he did earlier today & it was normal. Dr.Anna White asked if he has eaten anything today & Kameron advised he ate a couple hours ago. Dr. Anna White asked what did he eat? Kameron told her  he had Mash Potatoes, Pork Chop, & Corn( Let me add it was the smallest portion of food ever) but anyway Dr. Anna White then goes in to say this is a Non-Emergency Visit because if he tolerated a Meal it's not an Emergency! My response: it's an Emergency  to me because my Son never complains unless he is really sick & if he tells me he needs to go to the Dr. I'm going to bring him. Dr. Anna White then goes on to tell me that they are just counseling patients on Non-Emergency visits, I then cut her off in mid sentence & told her you don't have to help him we will leave because I felt she has had a long day & is now taking it out on us because she feels it's not an Emergency. My son has been at this ER dozens of times & we have never been treated this way. I don't want to ever in my Life step back into this ER as long as I'm breathing because I work in Healthcare as well & our Mission is to always make sure the patient is taken care of. Nurse was Great! Check-in Great! Wait was Ok! The Escort to the room was Great with a Smile! The Patient Coordinator was Great! Dr. Anna White is Horrible & I will write & call Patient Advocate to complain.

name: Amber Ramsey
text: Been sitting in the emergency room for almost three hours and we still don't know what's wrong with our daughter. Is the the doctor even here?

name: Stephanie McDaniel
text: Absolute nightmare. Wait was 4 hrs in waiting room, was back in our room another 8 hrs. Absolutely absurd to be an emergency room. And still no answers!

name: Jaber Alnajar
text: Minimum 6 hours that too much

name: Asia Lawson
text: Great and  caring service very loving faculty

name: Erica Melville
text: Horrible service, have been waiting for hours. Was kind of ghetto and overall a bad experience.

name: Courtney Brianna
text: Came here tonight because my 3 week old baby was sick and was told by her pediatrician to go to the ER if any worse.  That’s exactly what we did and we were told by the front desk staff that it would be another 5-6 hour wait IF things didn’t “change.”  We had already waited 3 and a half hours and decided to leave.  This used to be a great hospital but it’s going downhill quick.  I hope someone is capable of building another pediatric hospital in Alabama one day.  It will be a cold day in hell for me to come back.

name: Nugget_Loves _Gaming
text: The ER staff was great. This is the first place I have been where I was discriminated against for being white. Was told by the lobby lady it was closed to wait outside. I  just got discharged. While the lobby is filled with all black people coming in and out . That lady just walked in

name: Giovanni Bommarito
text: Fast, courteous and full of extremely talented staff. After a long streak of bad healthcare in other states USA health university hospital was a breath of fresh air. I can't thank them enough for helping me solve my maybe kidney problems or whatever it is bringing me to my knees in pain.

name: Dino Jebacinovic
text:
Never been in a worse and unprofessional hospital.
Nurse missed my vain 2 times and got me in the waiting room with my IV .

name: Mary Klier
text: My fiance was a patient in burn center after a work accident. The patient care was awful. From the time he was admitted until he was discharged it was one of the worst experiences of his life. The nurses and nurses assistants need to be reminded they are there for the patient. Leave your personal attitude at the time clock and remember you are there to take care of the patient.  You know it's bad when a staff member admits that they have problems within the hospital.  My fiance was given a full bottle of magnesium citrate for a little bit of constipation from the pain medication. Needless to say he became very ill and in the restroom all night while dealing with burns and no one came into his room to help him. This was totally unwarranted when all he needed was a mild laxative.  He did not need something that is used to  help clean your colon out. They forget there is a person beyond the bandages. The discharge was worse than his stay at the hospital. He was left in the lobby of the hospital for over two hours waiting on transport when he should have been in his room until his transport arrived. I would not recommend this hospital to anyone. I am not sure which was worse, the accident that burned him or the hospital stay and the staff.

name: Amber Bess
text: The emergency room was full but they got my Fiancé is very quickly. Angie and Julie were AMAZING. Took extra good care of my man ❤️

name: Stone Carrier
text: If you don't look hurt, don't come here. 9 hours of waiting, no referral paperwork, and information/test were done multiple times because of staff miscommunications. The fluid IV also had air bubbles in it because of being in a rush.

name: Frank Cornman
text: Worst place to go if you have chest pains and history of heart problems or previous heart attack. Been here 3 hrs for chest pains, not seen a Dr and I asked if they could at least take a blood test to check for elevated enzymes for signs of heart attach knowing that takes hours for results to come back. Was told no nurse practitioner on site at night to take blood. They are only here during the day. Will have to wait to see someone to take blood. WOW! Thought this was a emergency room hospital!

name: Paula Mcduffie
text: Colton is was wonderful.he went out of his way to help us through this ordeal

name: Cynthia Knee
text: I was in severe pain from a pinched nerve in my neck and was able to get in and out in 3.5 hours, which is about as quick as most Urgent Cares I've been to.  The ER doctor on 4-19-21 was very kind and treated me like he really cared about me.  All of the staff were very kind and made sure they told me they hoped I would feel better soon.  I was treated with dignity and respect.

name: Alexandra Pickle
text:
I tried to go there again.

When I walked in the waiting room was dirty and full of pretty sick people. One guy was coughing up blood, an older lady in a wheelchair with an oxygen tank was begging “please, help me”. But no, they didn’t have any rooms available to see them.

They said the longest waiting time that day was 4 hours. It didn’t look like it was going to be that short.

It was a regular day, nothing special.

I walked back out. At this point I’m willing to drive to Tennessee than go to Huntsville ERs.

Except Pediatric ER, Huntsville Pediatric ER is excellent in all the ways.

name: Amy Balentine
text: I went to the ER with a dog bite. They were very efficient and took care of me in a timely manner. Everyone from the front desk to the nurses and Dr were amazing. Highly recommend.

name: Daniel Dechenne
text: Horrible time management. Employees just wondering the Halls, aimlessly, with no sense of urgency or purpose. This is my third time being seen at this ER, and will definitely be my last. The standard of care is atrocious, you're expected to be a good patient, but there's no expectation for the healthcare providers to be good to you.

name: Wayne Meter
text:
I have never seen an ER like this, I brought In my 81 year old father that has dementia,  couldn't stand, high blood pressure and a blood clot in his left leg.
I was told to wait out in the parking garage and they would let me know if they needed me.
I could not get close to the doors because of the ( lak of a better term ) pit bull's guarding the entry way, they took him to check him in and he didn't know why he was here or what was wrong with him , finally they called us to come back to tell them what he was here for, it was just awful to let him sit alone in the reception area around people he didn't know or why he was abandoned by me.
Just very rude, uncaring staff but I bet if they brought in there own dad it would be a different story

name: Shelby Miles
text: Worst ER on the face of the planet. They wont let you know it will be a 12hr wait or longer until theyve already taken your info and started to charge you for your trip. I feel soo bad I cant finish this review. go somewhere else! also the nurses and all the back rooms smell like weed real bad

name: Rachel Hayes
text: The staff is fairly friendly from what I have seen during my 2-3 hour wait in the lobby, AFTER being brought in by an ambulance. But they are not time oriented at all.

name: Allison Dechenne
text: Ridiculous is the only word I can think of right now. 5 hours and counting with no communication and no help.

name: LC Ministry
text: GO TO A DIFFERENT ER! RUNNNNNNN!

name: Mallory
text:
I went into the Er in an ambulance needing a chest X-ray. After several hours, no contact with a doctor, several interactions w/rude, angry, uncaring and unprofessional nurses. I decided to leave. After requesting to speak to a doctor 4 times, I finally just left. My symptoms continued & worsened dramatically after leaving the ER. I called to get my Chest X-ray results so I wouldn’t have to repeat the same test at a more competent facility and have my insurance bill me for the cost of the same test done twice. “Johnna”, the ER nurse that answered the phone explained that it’s not her job to give patient test results over the phone and if my symptoms are worsening, that is completely my fault for leaving rather than wait hours for 1 doctor to rotate through 3 patients (1 whom was clearly deceased with the curtain open in his trauma bay while the staff discussed McDoubles & how annoying their patients are).
Whoever runs this sorry excuse for a medical facility should be ashamed. Everyone that works here needs to switch fields. Avoid this place at ALL costs. They will belittle you, & leave the curtain open over your bloody corpse while they discuss hamburgers. My deepest sympathies go out to that man’s family. You deserved so much better, I know you did. I’m sorry we ended up @ Huntsville Hospital ER.

name: rach hormel
text: You’ll probably die in waiting room before being seen

name: Ember Weaver
text: DO NOT COME TO THIS EMERGENCY ROOM. YOU WILL DIE IN THE LOBBY JUST WAITING TO BE CALLED BACK.

name: Noah Remo
text: got here around 7:30 pm and still here waiting at 1:30 am doesn’t seem as tho there’s any urgency whatsoever in this place

name: Ryan
text: I was charged twice for the same visit. I paid the co-pay right away, but they filed the bill to a credit company, so it was on my credit report! I had to pay for it again. I was planning on calling them regarding this, but will probably wait until the pandemic is eased a little.

name: Jacqueline Shaw
text: My husband waited 6 hours and ended up waking out because there was no sign of him being seen. It wasn't even late. He went in at 3pm after being told by nurse advice line to proceed to ER. Unacceptable.

name: Howard Mills
text: PATHETIC. I WENT IN ER WITH LIGHT PREASURE IN CHEST SKIPPING HEARTBEATS AND TINGLING LEFT HAND BUT NO MAJOR PAIN. I SAT IN THE WAITING ROOM FOR 7 HOURS JUST TO WATCH PEOPLE THAT I HAD BEEN THERE HOURS AHEAD OF COME AND GO IN THE ER. MY HEART HAD SETTLED DOWN WHILE IN THE WAITING ROOM FOR THOSE 7 HOURS. I FINALLY HAD TO LEAVE AROUND MIDNIGHT WITHOUT BEING SEEN. HOPE ITS NOTHING SERIOUS THAT WILL EFFECT ME LATER ON DOWN THE ROAD. I FEEL SORRY FOR SOMEONE WITH A SERIOUS PROMLEM AND NEEDS TO BE SEEN ASAP AT HH ER.

name: Kelly Jackson
text: I have nothing but nice things to say about my experience at the HH ER! I will admit that I was worried about going after reading all the terrible reviews. From the security guard to the nurses to the doctors, they were all so professional, helpful & comforting to me during a difficult situation.  I was seen quickly & treated with the upmost care the whole time. I am not going into details because this is a public forum but I HIGHLY recommend this establishment!  Shoutout to my nurses Emily, Lorie & Chandra (spelling?) for being so kind & going above & beyond to calm my nerves.

name: Jacob Haggermaker
text: They take there time, we've been waiting in the waiting room 3 hours to be seen. Just for them to pull someone who has been in here for only about 5 minutes. They barely acknowledge you being there. They have 4 people standing behind the front desk just talking. Not doing anything and when you say something they get hateful towards you

name: Keyome DT
text: My husband has a possible biceps tear. In pain. Turned away at the ER because he has a medical condition that won't allow him to wear a mask.

name: adva- KATE 4biglittlevoices
text: After having been in for heart problems and surgery, my sister who was released was told to report back to the er after having severe pain. The staff was horrendous to her, actually squeezing her arm “ saying I’ll give you something to cry about “ and then even accusing her of just being there to seek drugs ! Ludicrous! Would not send my DOG! They told her to leave , as she waited outside for husband to return, she was told she had waited long enough, get off the property and pointed her to the bus station ...

name: Mark Havira
text: Wait time wasn't bad. Staff was knowlegable and caring.

name: Joel Phelps
text: Finally gave up after over 7 hours of waiting in the ER.  While i am sure there was a system, there appeared to be no rhyme or reason on who went back.  People that came in long after my wife were seen and out the door while others were never called.

name: Evelyne Izeogu
text: Worse ER ever. Waiting time ridiculous. They made me go through so many steps, including checking vital signs multiple times, although my vital signs were perfect the first time they checked. I was called to see a Nurse Practitioner after waiting 7 hours, only for her to ask same information as the triage nurse. It's a joke!  I think they try to get as much money as they can, by making patients wait for a long time to see a doctor, in order to provide services that are not needed during the wait time. Stay away from that ER, unless you are brought in by ambulance.

name: Braden Hall
text: Don’t waste consuming oxygen there. Terrible oxygen.

name: Charles Washburn
text: Huntsville Hospital just does not care when people are in pain and there back is literally hot to the touch and the can't even give honest information about anything without have to back slide and not acknowledge that people are legitimately hurting and in pain the staff is just awful and not to mention the fact it is either HH or crestwood amd neither one is really worth a penny

name: Tony Madden
text: Night shift extremely fast service and unbelievable friendly staff on all levels.

name: Savannah Rosales
text: The front desk clerks were some of the rudest people I have met and I feel like they showed no compassion for any of the sick people that walk through the door. They also seemed very judgemental and gossipy about their patients, so if you want to be whispered about while on top of being sick, you've found the spot. All they care about is getting paid. I brought my mother in who has not eaten IN 3 DAYS, and we just continuously watched people that came in after us get treated. We stayed there for 7 hours after finally leaving without being seen. My mother does not have insurance and they have a sign on their wall that says that they will take care of the sick regardless of what type of insurance they might have. So HYPOCRITICAL. They need to tear that sign down because I have seen first-hand that it is not true. So now my unemployed mother will probably have an over $1000 bill for just sitting in a waiting room waisting her time. Also tried calling customer service and they just give you the run of the mill "We promise we do not treat our patients that way" and then transferring you to the next "person who will do something about it" which is a probably a continuous loop that will not do anything about the situation. Do not waste your breath or money at that horrible place.

name: cara kriegshauser
text: The wait time is outlandish!!!! When I went in they said 6 to 8 hour wait! I walked out and went to another hospital; got in, in 15 minutes.

name: Maria Rel
text: Everyone I dealt with was incredibly kind.

name: Bennie Griggs, III
text: My cousin had a stroke Feb 3. Came in today bc of high blood pressure. They are checking to make sure she doesn't have blood clots. Unfriendly staff, extremely long wait time. They have informed us twice that she has the longest wait and unfortunately they can't give a time when she will be seen. We have seen the ER get packed and thin out. This is unexceptional and subpar service Huntsville Hospital... You all need to do better and learn soft skills..

name: Jerry Lashley
text: Could be faster, but staff was very friendly despite their busy workload.

name: Joy Rosales
text:
Cold hearted people there. They may have signs posted basic care will be provided if you don't have insurance or are self-pay but what they do is put you at the bottom of the list & keep you there. I passed out at home yesterday.  My daughter drove me to tge ER so we wouldn't have HEMSI charges too. I had been battling flu-like symptoms 3 days by then, the worst of which were dehydration, nausea & diaharra.  I passed out in the car again on the way. They unloaded me into a wheelchair & shook me until I could fill out paperwork.  They triaged me fairly fast then parked us in the waiting room. They told me I was clinically dehydrated & would need an IV. So we began waiting.

There were a couple bad accidents so we had to wait longer. As bad as I was feeling, I had no issues with waiting because those should always be priority.  However, when we had been there over 3 hours & they started taking people back who were no less critical than I, it was upsetting. We stayed a little over 6 hours. I could no longer sit in the chair, my whole body was screaming in agony.  We walked out.

The nursing staff at the desk was neither nice or friendly.

name: Tamara Hilliard
text: We're leaving without seeing a doctor after nearly twelve hours in the emergency waiting room. We were sent by a doctor who was concerned about an ECG. Evidently, Huntsville Hospital was less concerned.

name: Carla Davis
text:
Two reviews below
One:
The employees of the Huntsville Hospital Main Emergency Room desk and Triage are so rude and burnt out, I will never trust them to care for my family again.
Took my roommate in the middle of the night at 1a.m. in a rush to this ER as she woke up in writhing screaming pain in her pelvic area and lower abdomen. She said she felt like something was falling out in her vaginal area. When we arrived the staff at Huntsville Hospital ER desk and Triage were so rude to her and acted as if they didn't believe her. She was crying hysterically and they asked her if she was on drugs because of her behavior. She was in serious massive pain.
They treated her like as if she was a drug seeker. And I understand that they deal with a lot of drug seekers but my roommate doesn't even like nor can take opiates for pain so she would have refused them if even offered...so it was rediculous to treat her this way. And it wasn't just her...the staff was rude and hateful towards all the patients in the ER. Finally after waiting for several hours we left without her seeing a doctor or ever getting to a room. Noone checked on her, we were never given any compassion or updates.

This hospital needs some training for the employees in being nice towards customers.

Second review:
Review for Huntsville Hospital Emergency Dept.
Mar 31, 2016
Do not use Huntsville Hospital's ER even if you are on death's doorstep. Last night I was rushed by my family to the hospital ER after falling into a sink corner and splitting my skull open. I had lost a couple quarts of blood and my hair, face, shirt and hands were soaked with constant bleeding from my head that would not stop. I was left in the waiting room for nine hours sitting amongst vomiting flu patients in this condition without being offered a towel or bandage. The only nurse that even noticed me got angry with me for bleeding on the floor. My family members repeatedly asked for a house nurse or supervisor and the nurses made fun of me and never got any supervisor or head nurse of any kind. I was treated with disrespect, unkindness and absolutely no compassion. The employees seemed so numb to patients needs that they did the very minimum their jobs required and spent most of their time belittling and making fun of patients who were truly hurt or sick. Two nurses who seemed to be the ones in charge more than anyone else were making fun of patients and literally making bets with the security guards about how many times certain patients would throw up or moan. I have never seen such a lack of empathy. I finally left the ER waiting room without ever receiving medical treatment or even one kind word from any employee, receptionist or nurse. I will absolutely never trust Huntsville Hospital for my medical needs and I will urge everyone I know to stay far away from this understaffed unprofessional joke of an emergency room. This place needs to be shut down if they can't get their act together. Both of my parents used to work for Huntsville Hospital, mom for many years it hasnt always been this bad. Also,I have two forms of excellent premium medical insurance. I am in such utter disbelief at how terribly I was treated. What happened to this ER to make it so unorganized and under staffed? Where is the management?
.

text:

resp.text: We're disappointed to hear of these experiences. We can assure you that we do not find this type of behavior acceptable, and we will be addressing any such situation. A lot of it is fixed but like I said, at the cost of my time.

There was only 5 people a head of me and they called 1 back with me. I asked for blanket because it was freezing in the waiting room and they wouldn't give me one. I needed at least 20 stitches yet the person who stitched me up only put 9 stitches.  It looks like Frankenstein stitched me up. I spent 4 hours there and it wasn't busy. I will never go back to this emergency room again.  They are unprofessional and made me wait 4 hours in pain.
