name: Janie Kinard
text:
My Mom was taken to the ER by ambulance almost 2 weeks ago. My sister was with her and I knew that it was serious because the doctors were asking for her wishes. My adult children and I flew to the hospital where we met Barney Fife security guard who told me that my children, her grandchildren were not immediate family and could not enter. After a standoff, he told me that he would allow them to enter and followed with that’s just the protocol for EOL patients. After he called my Mother an EOL patient again, I looked at him confused and he said, “ oh, you know... END OF LIFE patients. That’s just what we call them.” My children and I are speechless!!! He later busts into the family room where they are keeping us and asked if we had left something at his desk that he had in his hand, I couldn’t even tell you what that was.. He then just shrugged his shoulders and said oh well and left.

The nurse who stayed in the room with my Mom was great!! He went out of his way to make sure that we knew what to expect during her transfer to ICU and while she was in the room. He called upstairs to make sure that we would all be able to see her before we left that day, but that after that, the visitation was restricted to 2 visitors per day.

They move Mom upstairs and NONE of us are allowed to see her before we leave!

I understand that we are in a pandemic, but this place was so unorganized and the security personnel were EXTREMELY unsympathetic for why we were there.

Tuscaloosa desperately needs another hospital to give patients a choice of where to go and maybe they would care more.

Not now nor have I EVER been impressed with this ER!!

name: 2010Aubie
text: My mother in law was admitted to the emergency room this morning. I live out of the state, so I called to get an update on her condition. Olivia is her nurse, and took the time to explain everything to me.She was very professional, kind and caring. I am so thankful she is in charge of my mother in law, I can tell she is an excellent nurse.

name: Samantha Waldrop
text: Avoid going here unless you’re literally bleeding out or something because they don’t care, especially if you don’t have insurance. The nurses have no idea what they’re doing, my uncle had a heart attack, they kept him for two days trying to get his blood pressure down which they weren’t able to do so they just released him. We expect to be back soon, hopefully not there if at all possible, we just hope it won’t be worse next time. They basically said come back if it happens again. Not to mention the terrible service and him having to wait two hours every time he asked for a drink.

name: Ella Siccardi
text: If I could give zero stars, I'd consider it. I'm a freshman who's never stepped foot in to an ER, attending the university. I was sent here after being referred for likely appendicitis accompanied by pretty extreme pain. I was here for ten hours on a random Thursday night for nothing more than a CT scan. Five hours were spent in the waiting room and five more were in a tiny room. Though the CT scan was clear, the doctors claimed to have no idea what was wrong with me and sent me on my way after giving me IVs and a random "diagnosis" of kidney stones. I got in touch with the doctor who referred me, who did not at all agree with the diagnosis and was shocked that they did nothing. He prescribed antibiotics, which kicked what turned out to be an intestinal infection right out. The nurses at the ER were kind and made me feel better, but as a whole, the experience sucked and I cannot recommend this place at all unless you're actively bleeding out. If you can help it, make the drive to Birmingham (or anywhere else for that matter).

name: BA M
text:
Here visiting my boyfriend from California, unfortunately got very ill and have been here in severe pain and nausea for over 4 hours. Still in the waiting room with a needle in my arm despite telling them I need them to use my chest port. I'm alone and afraid on top of being iller than I've been in years. This place is filthy and no one has any information on anything and get really upset when asked.
My boyfriend had to leave because they would only allow him in if I had a room.
I'm seriously wondering if im going to die in this waiting room and if the staff will notice.

name: ramsay mason
text:
I am here at the moment. 10:50pm. Been here since 8pm. So not long. I think I have a concussion. My vision is blurry, I'm passing out, my ears are ringing, my head is pounding, I'm nauseous, and I'm super dazed. They call me back, say they'll give me a CT scan and an EKG. They give me the CT scan, then put me back in the waiting room. I asked the nurse if this was where I'm supposed to be and she says it is. Next thing I know, a siren is going off and I get super dizzy and my head starts pounding and I feel like passing out. I've told every nurse I've seen that I feel super dizzy, and they don't seem to care. I really need to lay down and I feel like I'm on the verge of passing out. I feel like I'm not getting proper care and I hope this concussion isn't super bad, because if it is, I'm confident that I'll never find out. Cannot believe I have to pay for this "care." I'm struggling to type this out, but know this: DO NOT COME HERE. GO TO NORTHPORT REGIONAL EMERGENCY OR DRIVE TO UAB IF YOU CAN.

Update: I got back, and about 10 minutes later a doctor said they only need to do the EKG if I "passed out" and used quotation hand gestures when saying my symptoms. I told him I wanted it if it was necessary, and that I did pass out. Totally acted like he did not care, and acted like he didn't believe my symptoms. Had a really bad attitude, so if something is wrong with me, I'll never know because he refused to give me the EKG. NEVER COME HERE. GO SOMEWHERE WHERE THEY WILL TAKE YOU SERIOUSLY.

Update: It is the morning after. I'm still super dizzy and feel like passing out and my heart is racing. I went to an urgent care and got an EKG done... Turns out I did need one and I needed even more tests ran.

name: Nicole T. Springer
text: They work so hard and serve over 11 counties. The way they have treated me from my COVID-19 diagnosis to injuries in the kitchen has been nothing but great and kind. The wait time is long, certainly. However, the care I have received after being in ER departments in many places due to chronic illnesses, DCH ranks as one of the best experiences. Also compared to EAMC in Auburn, DCH is significantly better and in a better place. Some people treat the staff here disrespectfully and it has definitely been a lot on the nurses and doctors, but they are performing essential services for a large population. They are doing the best they can and I appreciate their empathy, respect, and help. They are wonderful.

name: Chris Neven
text: There is a reason why people refer to DCH as Don’t Come Here Hospital. My daughter was brought in by ambulance over 6 hours ago with severe chest pain. She was unable to stand up because she was in so much pain. Unfortunately DCH was the closest hospital so coming here was out of her control. They sat her in the waiting room and one of the nurses yelled at her for whining and told her to knock it off.  The IV the paramedics gave her came out and again, this same nurse yelled at my daughter and told her it was her fault. They did do an EKG after 2.5 hours of being there, and did bloodwork, x-rays and a urine test but still no results. 6 hours later and they hadn’t even take her vitals!  I called 3 different times and spoke with 3 different people and was given different stories each time. This is a hospital near a university campus. When there are parents, such as myself, that are 2,200 miles away, a reliable healthcare facility should be available to our children. DCH is not that facility. I feel for the employees that worn there. They obviously don’t have the motivation to provide top notch care because they work for a incompetent management team.

name: Meagan Hughes
text: Took my Father to the ER with certainty that his appendix had ruptured, security guard and nurse took their time getting to my dad 2 feet away from them. Nurse STROLLED to get a wheelchair for him. Wouldn’t let me write information for my dad down in the entrance of the emergency door. Had to leave and no one gave us updates for an hour. This hospital is a joke.

name: Christopher A.
text:
Just in case you don't know, DCH stands for Don't Come Here. I waited NINE HOURS to be seen for an emergency. There is a lot more I could say, but... yeah. The people themselves weren't bad, just rushed. Which I don't understand because there really didn't seem to be many people there. And nobody talks to each other.
Then again, I highly doubt that the hospital system is ever going to read these reviews, because they make money hand over fist.
One time my ex came and they put in a referral to UAB with a single comment: provide better care.
No joke. They are unequipped here. If you can help it, go to UAB in Birmingham. For the love of God.

name: David Oswalt
text: Was brought here on 9/30/20 for chest pain. The rn i had once i was called back was pathetic. No communication skills whatsoever. Now im in the willard unit. Communication skills lack here as well. You can tell the difference between a dedicated nurse and one thats in it for the paycheck.  On a good note i would give my er dr. Dr Evans 5 stars. She is awesome.

name: khadijah williams
text: Been here over 2hours and 30 minutes still waiting for a room smh slow place

name: Malik Alexander
text: Disorganized and disgraceful. Every request takes extended time, despite this being the 'ER'. I was left in my room unattended for almost 2 hours with no update due to a 'miscommunication during a shift change'. Thank goodness I wasn't in any actual immediate danger. I was there for over 6 hours and literally all I was doing was getting an ultrasound for a possible blood clot. My results took another 45 minutes despite it being something that can be immediately checked. I will never willingly return.

name: J. S. Roman
text: I am so frustrated that I actually have to give at least a star in order to write a review.

name: Benjamin and Alisha Sharp
text: Whole system need a do over. Horrible place horrible staff just horrible. Waited for 6 hours still hadn’t been seen. Smh

name: Tyler Audie
text: Went in there with a burnt finger and proceeded to wait for nearly 2 hours before being seen. This wouldn’t have been an issue if it weren’t for the fact that there were only 2 people seen before me. I’m not a doctor but that seems kind of absurd. 1/5 no cap

name: J Marable
text: People come to the er because there’s nowhere else to go after hours and they need help, not to sit for hours and hours in pain and distress. Where is the care? Explain to people if and when they come in that unless they’re at deaths door, they may not be seen, that you are short staffed and you could possibly be there all night. We don’t come to sit for hours to give you a hard time, it’s because we need medical attention.

name: Velva Harless
text:
I wouldn't ever go there again! Nurse Sue you need alot of training on bedside manners and your rude staff don't even deserve to be associated with other people. Shame on All of you!? .

..

name: Greg Jason
text: Went to the ER with a torn labrum. I can deal with the fact that it took 2 hours to be seen, but once I got my hospital band I noticed they had gotten my last name wrong. I told every nurse that saw me, as well as the doctor that wrote my prescription. They all said they would have it fixed. When I went to the pharmacy, the medicine was under the incorrect last name and I was not able to get it. I had to go back to the ER and wait another 2 hours to see the doctor just to get my prescription sorted out. If you need to go to the ER, do yourself a favor and make the hour drive to Birmingham. It will be a much shorter process in the long run.

name: Tracey-Renee Hinton
text: Dr. Lovely is unprofessional and runs a unethical, corrupt ER staff. He needs to be evaluated and investigated for how he runs this ER from hell and then he should have his license revoked at the very least. Just a reminder to the Upper Mgmnt that allow him to do as he wishes, Karma is real and you all have a rude awakening when all the ER secrets come out to the light.  Lastly, this Arragant, non- compassoniate Idiot over the ER at DCH, has MD after his name, not GOD.  What is done in the dark ALWAYS comes to light. ALWAYS.

name: JRenee
text: I give the ER nurse Lauren🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 she was great and very concerned. The doctor I seen is the reason I rated my visit a 2star. He was very rude, impatient and unconcerned about my health. I would go back only if he is NOT there.

name: Shawntis Tarver
text: This place sucks they have people packed out in the lobby for hours,while they sit around on their phones and hold personal conversations.
